Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DeCrequi
Reviews.Content: This is no more than a bog standard hotel, good location, good selection for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and offers a great breakfast. However, the desk staff was very curt. The rooms were stuffy and if you opened the windows it was noisey. The sheets were scratchy. The hair dryers were a joke. Not as nice as other hotels on our Globus Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HarryThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cicerone hotel for three nights April 2012. The staff was helpful and fast, room was quiet, clean and normal size, bathroom was also big. The location is great, Vatican and St Peter are very near. First we thought that we would be far away from the popular "piazzas", which are located at the other side of the river but we walked even down to Colosseum very easy. There are many interesting shops at the nearby Cola di Rienzo and every day we visited restaurants around with the highest ranking in tripadvisor and we did not regret even one time. For its money I think it is a honest proposal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: headleyw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for three nights. It is in a great location. Walking distance from the Vatican, and most of the great sites in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: OroLoves2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed (group of 7) at The Ciceron for 2 nights March 18 & 19, 2012 and we really enjoyed it. The staff was very nice and very helpful. The hotel is in a great location. You can walk to a lot of restaurants. Louis at the front desk is great. He recommended a rally nice restaurant within walking distance " Ristorante Penna La d'Oca" We had the Roman meal ad it was delicious. We paid approx 50EUR but very worth it. We had a 7 course meal and it included wine. And you must stop by at hotel bar and have some drinks. Marco is a great bar tender. He not only knows his alcohol but he also know his history. It was an educational bar and history experience. We had so many great laughs....thanks Marco. I now know how grappa is made. It's actually pretty tasty. Overall experience at this hotel was great. Great staff and great location. I give it a thumbs up! Go see Marco at the Ciceron Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking.”
Reviews.Author: guyzemail
Reviews.Content: 4 star? well the beautiful hotel next door was definitely 4 star - maybe more - but the Cicerone falls far short. Main problem is lack of invetsment so I guess it belongs to some group or an investment firm whose managers stay some place else. The rooms that have become too dirty or threadbare have had their carpets removed and that begets a sound problem... For goodness sake - go buy a rug. Breakfast was dismal - a good enough looking selection of continental style ingredients but standard very poor and the coffee undrinkable. The location is good and the hotel probably survives on that alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Rob111111
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Rome after spending 4 nights in Cicerone. I would say this hotel deserves maybe 3 and a half or almost 4 stars. Location is just excellent - walking distance to Trinita dei Monti, Piaza Navona, Trastevere, Campo do Fiori, Vaticano, Fontana di Trevi, Pantheon. I walked and walked every day and it was really comfortable to stay in Cicerone to reach all those places in a very short time. Breakfast was rather average then good although the buffet was full of products. My room was placed on the 8th floor (attic) so the lift goes to 7th floor only and then stairs, what was no problem at all for me - I could walk even more for this low price which was half price then - special price. Rooms in the attic were rather small, but comfortable enough, bathroom was also O.K. besides the shower tube was not working good. There where rather small windows in the top part of the room, but it was not important to me to have big windows as I spent each day outside of the room. Generally good hotel with some negative points.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, but in a good position and w a good price.”
Reviews.Author: enricoca
Reviews.Content: It doesn't work for a couple searching for a romantic relais in the heart of Rome, but this hotel offers a good position and a good price. Seems to be in a Sheraton placed everywhere in the world, rooms large and cleaned with unpersonl touch about furniture. But for €100 you're 10 minutes walking from both Vaticano and Piazza del popolo, Trastevere and Trinità dei monti. Better coming without a car. No hotel parking, with plenty of private garages close to the hotel (up to €45 per day, closing time changes, no more than 1am, coming from the beginning of via cicerone, turn the first on the right and choose the one in the right hand, cheaper-€35). Avoid rooms Via Cicerone side, really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for business or holiday”
Reviews.Author: Pete E
Reviews.Content: My first stay at Hotel Cicerone was 1989, I've never stayed any where else in the center of Rome since. I was there again on business early Jan. 2012, greeted by the friendly familiar team at the front desk, my room was clean, as always, and very reasonable. Gianni and Marco at the bar are extremely helpful, professional and "good guys"! Great location, great staff and reasonable I will continue to book at Cicerone! Pete Ettinger Albuquerque, NM USA

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Cicerone!”
Reviews.Author: Lynda M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights from Dec. 21-29, 2012 and the hotel staff was wonderful. There were 4 of us traveling. Front desk was very helpful. Location of this hotel is central to Vatican City, Piazza Popolo, Piazza Narvona, Spanish steps and Trevi. Easy walks all ways. The neighborhood restaurants are very charming and offer great food close to the hotel. But the highlight of our stay at Cicerone were our bartenders - Marco, Dominic and Hillary! They were always pleasant and had great advice for places to eat and things to do in the neighborhood. We stopped by each day to chat with them. We were especially impressed since we were there over Christmas, and the bar staff seemed to enjoy being at the hotel as well. (no griping about working the holiday) They definitely made our trip extra special. We highly suggest staying at this hotel. Tony & Lynda Martino

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: Anniebannie1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Cicerone with my Mum as we were told it was close to the Vatican. The hotel was lovely and clean. The staff at the desk and the bar were a little impersonal, but this did not spoil our thoughts of the hotel. Very busy hotel with people and tours coming in and out all day. The concierge helped us to book a tour to Castel Gandolfo, the Pope's Summer residence to hear his Sunday address. We were very lucky as we got the last two tickets on the bus for the trip. Also the same concierge helped us to find our way around Rome and to locate an open top tour bus. We were on the wrong side of the city for the shops and other amenities, but we still had three good days of touring. Stayed here in September 2010

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Donna A
Reviews.Content: We have been guests at the Cicerone Hotel in Rome 5 times. What keeps us coming back? Location, cleanliness and the best Bar Staff in Rome. Marco Tozzetti is not only a great bartender but he is very helpful on things to do and see in Rome. Gianni, Ilaria and Dominico also can not do enough for you. We stopped by the bar boeth before and after dinner to enjoy their company; talk about what we had done during the day and get ideas for our next day. Can't wait to go back. When in Rome, if you don't stay at the Cicerone be sure to stop in and enjoy a drink with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: Carla M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August and loved it. Hotel is in an excellent location, close to the Vatican, shops, bars and cafes. A quick hop on the metro takes you along to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Rooms are good size and hotel staff were very helful and friendly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Big City, Big Rooms, Big Bar Tab”
Reviews.Author: NC_tar_heel_64
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group, and this hotel seems to handle many groups. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. This is located in an area with many good and small restaurants, and an excellent gelato shop 2 blocks away. Those with rooms on the main street complained of noise, but I was fine- expecting noise in a big city. Breakfast offerings were plentiful and varied, and wait staff will bring you espresso or capuchinno if you don't want the cafe american. I was shocked at the prices in the hotel bar: a shot of limoncello was 6 euro, and a simple gin and tonic was 12 euro! Drink at dinner, not the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Winter visit”
Reviews.Author: JWC87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Christmas Day to New Year's Day. Breakfast buffet good - cereals, fruit, juices, bread, eggs and meat. Location great - we walked to all of the sites - the Vatican, Colosseum, Forum, ST Peters, etc. Hotel room a bit noisy on street side of building. No free wifi was a bother but available for 7 euros/24 hours. Staff most helpful. Lunch one day in the hotel restaurant was great - salads, shellfish. We'd stay again simply because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “December visit”
Reviews.Author: 00-Bywell-00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cicerone for six nights. We were on the sixth floor in the front facing the street. We were able to turn the heat down and the street noise was only a problem if we had the windows open. The hotel desk staff could not have been more wonderful. They helped us with road race registrations, dinner reservations, sent faxes and made telephone calls for us. We loved the breakfast each morning. My only suggestion would be to apply the cost of the internet wireless across all room charges. We would definitely stay at the Cicerone again.

Reviews.Title: “Temperature problem”
Reviews.Author: squizz20
Reviews.Content: Despite switching off the heating and opening the windows my room was piping hot. I'm a frequent traveller and always sleep, but the heat kept me awake all night (in December). I asked the staff in the morning to switch off the heating, and I was told in that particular room there were "internal tubes" of the hotel that heated up the room in an irreversibl way and I was offereda different room for the other nights. I don't see why the room was in use, given the problem was known and another one available. My room was 749, but my colleagues had similar problems albeit less extreme. The best seems to ask for a room on the external side of the hotel/ street side. Temperature problem was a shame, since there were many good things too, but this spoilt it all for me (the arrangement included newspaper in the morning, welcome bag of typical Italian sweets (confetti), beauty products in the bathroom, excellent food in the restaurant, friendly restaurant staff), Breakfast was a wide choice but not superfresh products. Coffee was served fresh though, and good and so was the croissant. I would have appreciated though if the bread, marmelade and fruit juice had been fresh. Would not come back as this lack of respect using a knowingly overheated room put me off.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cicerone in August as part of a tour. The concierge was extremely helpful in finding me a local travel agent so I could continue my independent journey. The room was average, not huge, and the stall shower was unique, with very little room to move around. The breakfast room was large, with an excellent selection, and made a great start for each day. Easy walking around the city from here, including the Vatican, Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The décor in the rooms is dated, but since I'm on vacation, and only really there to sleep, I don't care. The balcony was a bonus during the heat wave. Internet access is available, but like many hotels, just not worth the exorbitant fees. .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not lavish but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisTourist39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within 15 minutes of the Vatican & St. Peter's, and only about 1 block from a small grocery store. Our room on the 3rd floor was clean and updated, not 1970s style like some reviewers mentioned. Just don't expect the Hilton. It's smaller & simpler, but you're in Rome, so it all evens out. Cereal, fruit, lots of bread/meat/cheese to choose from at breakfast, plus bacon and eggs. The hotel is also about 3 blocks from the subway, super convenient. There's also a great little pizza place right across the street from the hotel, where we went on a rainy night when we didn't want to walk far. The only "downer" was the hotel staff behind the front desk, who were rude even to my elderly mother, who has the manners of Queen Elizabeth and the patience of a saint. Oh well, we saw them little enough. Just enjoy Rome and don't expect a friendly hotel staff if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from 6th floor!”
Reviews.Author: subscriptions4george
Reviews.Content: It's OK but not 4 star. Rooms are big enough and breakfast is plentiful if a bit chaotic. The whole place is in desperate need of updating. Upmarket 70's decor. The 6th floor has some nicer rooms but most of it sits underneath the boilers/heating pipes. This makes the rooms unbearably hot. In November it was 6C outside. I had both windows open but it was still unbearably hot inside all through the night. I lay without any sheets over me too! The air conditioning blew HOT air into the room even turned to the lowest setting. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Robin K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, clean and well located. The staff was most helpful especially Louis, the night concierge. Easy walk to the Vatican. Breakfast was varied and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible for a short stay....”
Reviews.Author: photogfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 10 minute, easy walk to the central Piazza and not far from Vatican City. Was there for 2 nights as part of a tour, so did not try the restaurant onsite. We did get a breakfast buffet that was good, with a lot of choice. Hotel is old, feels like the 70's, but very clean. Front desk staff is accomodating. Rugs in the rooms are old and like sandpaper! Room size is not bad for a European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OVERNIGHT @ THE CICERONE”
Reviews.Author: cpfton
Reviews.Content: We were on our way home from a princess cruise and booked in the Cicerone for one night. We had a pleasent stay. The hotel was clean, we did not try the restaurant becouse the are just to many good places to eat in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Staff helpful however the building and decor in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only one night. I was not impressed by the decor or condition of the hotel. The rooms where large by Europen standards. The carpet wall coverings and drapery in my room gave me the creeps. It was very dated and did not give me the feel of being in a clean room. I found the staff to be very helpful in giving directions in getting around Rome. I would not reccomend this hotel because of the above stated reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Anti-American”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: From the television stations, including the constant USA bashing Russia Today, (among others) to the completely rude staff do not expect to be treated decently if you are American. This hotel and staff were equally pathetic and an affront to ones senses. I mean that literally. Be sure to bring along some extra deodorant to hand out to the staff. I think the reason the hotel is called a 4 star hotel is because the sign above the entrance has 4 stars next to the name. The $500 per night room was small, shabby and had a great view of the back of some nondescript building where you could hear and see trash being removed daily. The breakfast buffet actually had POWDERED EGGS (when was the last time you had powdered eggs at a $500 a night hotel) and to get the waitsaff to help in any way was a lost cause. The hotel lobby staff was equally as bad. It was a major effort just to get them to recognize we were in front of them asking questions that needed to be answered. Location was not great but is the only possible reason not to give the hotel a zero rating. We have been to many countries before and have never been treated this poorly. This truly was Euro Trash at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Not as the Romans do”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone Hotel as part of a tour group, so you don't expect the best , but you do expect clean and comfortable,the Cicerone offers neither. The location is ok, not great but not terrible, there was not much around it. The rooms were a decent size, but the room was very tired and the walls floors etc. needed a good painting and washing. I would not stay at this hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing end to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Don015
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled for 16 days with 3 other couples and our trip ended in Rome. We had prepaid our vacation 6 mos.+ prior to our departure date only to find out that one couple could stay at this hotel and 3 couples were moved to another hotel. The only explanation that we could interpret was there was water damage on the 7th floor. I personally walked through the 7th floor and no construction/repairs were taking place. CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS NON EXISTENT..FRONT DESK STAFF APPEARED TO BE TOO BUSY AND NOT SHOWING ANY CARE OR CONCERN. Personally I fell they were over booked as many tour groups were operating from this hotel. Also as a final note our room was located on a main street,(front of hotel) which wasvery noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ejfraser
Reviews.Content: Part of an organised Page&Moy holiday. The staff were very helpful and friendly for a very large city hotel dealing with numerous demanding overseas guests. Very good breakfast despite very busy dining room . Items replenished frequently. Excellent location. Numerous eating places locally. BIGGEST down side is its used by many tour operators including "cruise" stays. TOO MANY Americans who don't have the ability to speak quietly making the dining room very uncomfortable at times. They have no Manners! Bar prices ok for such a luxurious Hotel. Impressive marble decor.

Reviews.Title: “well situated hotel hotel near vatican”
Reviews.Author: km0722
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is located close to the Vatican and also to Via Cola de Rienza one of the best shopping area of Rome. It is within walking distance of the Vatican, the shopping district, Piazza di Populo, and Castel San Angelo. While the area appears more residential access to sites and tourist areas is easy. There are trattorias and small shops nearby also for pizza or a dinner on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but very average....”
Reviews.Author: TomC294217
Reviews.Content: Positive: (1) this hotel is really well-located on the Vatican side of the river. Provided you are reasonably fit, it is possible to walk to most of the major tourist attractions in Rome. (2) It is a competively priced hotel Negative: (1) the hotel does not really deserve to be called a 4* hotel - whilst clean, the fixtures and fittings are very tired (carpets threadbare etc) and very dated. Breakfast is very average. (2) Service is, at best, impersonal and, at worst, poor. This particularly applies to front desk staff who could not have been less interested in serving guests. However, even they were outdone by the barman in hotel bar who was both petty and obnoxious. Someone really needs to remind him that hotel guests pay his wages....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jager11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night. Very close to Vatican City. 2 Internet machines available at a cost. Hotel food is pretty good. Rooms are quite small. Bathroom is decent, but shower is very small. Water temperature was impossible to control (read: scalding). Didn't visit bar (we were out on the town!!).

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: av3206
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the hotel for 1 week. The hotel was in a great location. You could walk everywhere important in Rome. 6ish euro cab ride to the train station for day trips. Rooms were ok. Beds and pillows were awful that was my only real complaint. Bathroom was good shower worked fine. Tvs were bad too trying to catch up on any news from home was impossible. Wifi was a joke 9 euro a day. Staff was really nice. The free breakfast ment well and was ok for a few days but after 1 week it was starting to wear on me. For the price it was a decent deal there are probably better hotels to stay at but all and all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: If you have read any of the other reviews here, you may have mixed emotions about staying at the Cicerone. Our experience was positive overall. The hotel is centrally located to numerous sites, restaurants, and shopping. The room was clean and had the best air-conditioning of all the hotels we visited in the heat of August. The front desk staff may have been the least hospitable of any place I have ever stayed. Internet access is expensive and cost are charged based upon your hardware. I had a laptop and an iPad2 and had to pay separately for access. When I asked, "Isn't that a bit odd?"...the response by the front desk staff, "I have heard that question before."

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Teri48
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3pm and our room was ready and nice and air conditioned ( it was 34 degrees celcius out ) so we were ready for a shower and a quick rest! The front desk was very helpful and a nice young man carried our bags up for us. The breakfast the next morning was delicious. Hot coffee and milk at your table in an instant,or cappicino made up for you on order! There was plenty of hot food to go around plus fruit and cereal. We stayed for 3 nights and it was a 15 minute walk to the Vatican and close to many other attractions.There is a decent grocery store 2 blocks away as well as other stores that run for about 2 blocks. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay -- would return”
Reviews.Author: Weekender26
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Cicerone Hotel was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a nice size and clean. Our room was at the end of the floor and had a balcony -- so this might have been a nicer room than the others. There was Internet access, but it was not free. There was climate control in the room. The front desk was polite and quickly addressed our needs. The breakfast spread was good. It included fresh fruit, meats, eggs, rolls and pastries. There was coffee and tea but you had to wait for a server and that service declined as breakfast winded down. It is on the Vatican side of the Tiber River. There was plenty to see within walking distance, but a cab or bus would be wise if you plan on going far.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but needs major upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: Julie2115
Reviews.Content: It was a more modern hotel, but it was obvious that they had not refurbished the rooms and bathrooms since they opened it. The tub did not drain properly and the position of the shower head caused water to leak on the floor. The breakfast was great and the staff were easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, on the Vatican side of the river, well priced”
Reviews.Author: use_2_love_2_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of our family vacation. We had actually booked accommodations elsewhere which we walked into and immediately started looking for something else. The Cicerone is what we found. It is comfortable and well maintained. It is certainly not the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in (I didn't walk around without slippers in the room) and I will probably never return. The front desk staff was somewhat helpful, but nobody put themselves out for us. It is close to the Vatican but since most tourist sites are on the other side of the Tiber River, each taxi ride was more expensive than it might otherwise have been. A less hectic and harried search would probably have located a hotel that better fit our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Its a dump”
Reviews.Author: Andrew04111950
Reviews.Content: Concierge was rude, reception staff even ruder. One of the lifts didnt work. The hall carpet was badly worn. The photos pictured on their website is nothing like the reality. Rooms were decrepit. Whole place needed upgrading. No free internet. Worst hotel we stayed at in Italy

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: adrimare
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with 3 adults. We had the best service. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable. Lots of food choices and even espresso/cappuccino on demand. Price was very reasonable. Location the best. Lots of high quality restaurants around, especially Ristorante Ambasciata Di Capri. Also free Wi-Fi internet 2 blocks away at Mondo Arancina 38 Via Marcantonio Colonna.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: MonaClaremont_CA
Reviews.Content: We were here with family; and this is a hotel that conforms to North American standards more than most. It is modern, spacious and has rooms for three or four, which is a plus in an European hotel. The breakfast is varied and ample. The staff are helpful and seem genuinely happy to help. Many speak English quite well - far better than my childhood-acquired Italian! The hotel is located within walking distance of the Tiber River, Fortress San't Angelo and the Vatican. It is not a long walk to Piazza dei Populi. There are restaurants with sidewalk seating all around, even though there are many court buildings in this area. We were not first time travellers to Italy and have stayed in all manner of accommodations there. I would recommend this hotel to families visiting Rome, any first-time travelers, and those who want to be in a hotel where they can feel safe walking just about anywhere. This hotel is good value for a world-class city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Put Out”
Reviews.Author: Kelcee1049
Reviews.Content: Our family booked the Cicerone a year in advance and when the seven of us arrived, we were told taxis were going to take us to a "comparable" hotel because our rooms at the Cicerone were flooded. We were asked to pay them first and they would bill the other hotel. When we refused, we were treated very rudely by the reception staff and told we had a contract with them. Finally, we went to the other hotel which turned out to be very nice but with fewer ammenities--the room rate there was 100 Euros less. The Cicerone attempted to charge my credit card they had on file, but luckily, that card was no longer valid. I would never recommend a hotel who puts you out and tries to charge your credit card for a stay you did not experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Helenecruise
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Cicerone Hotel on 4 occasions. The staff never seem to change. They are really helpful and the position of the hotel is great. Many of the rooms have been upgraded and it is a very comfortable room, certainly not delux but very adequate. The neighbourhood is really safe to walk through in the evening. The hotel is used by many cruise companies for pre or post Rome stays. The hotel can also organise a taxi down to Civitavechia before or after the cruise and the prices you get from the hotel is actually much cheaper than if you organise privately. Breakfasts are great and their is always more than enough to have. Will always use this hotel while in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good location end of tour”
Reviews.Author: jerimack
Reviews.Content: Very Busy hotel Some rooms needs redecorating Clean enough good buffet breakfast close to shopping and walking areas close to good restaurants internet ok

Reviews.Title: “Location is better part of stay here”
Reviews.Author: OziCouple
Reviews.Content: Staying on tour requires a rapid move through checkin, and breakfast as usually someone is last, and late... The lines at check in are long, at breakfast long... but overall the stay was ok... The rooms are ornate ... maybe excessively so ... But the location is excellent in easy stroll of some of the sites... No iron in room ( apparantly standard in Italy) No toast at breakfast ( again standard) Italy has a rep as being rude... we didnt find that at all... as being chaotic... thats for sure right... but in the end through some miracle gets things done... when You leave you wonder how... but they do get things done somehow

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: sssster
Reviews.Content: Located about 8 blocks east of the Vatican and 4 blocks north of the Tiber River. An excellent location for seeing the Vatican and much of downtown Rome. In good weather, this will be within walking distance of the Forum and the Colosseum - but it'll be a fair hike in hot weather. This hotel seems to cater to tour groups, which is OK, but be prepared for crowds in the lobby at times and competition for an elevator when the tours arrive. Staff are helpful and courteous, but not outright friendly and gregarious. I try to be cheerful and easygoing with the staff because I usually find you get better treatment that way. Didn't work here. The woman at check-in obviously had been worn to a frazzle dealing with groups and didn't care for my nice smile and attempt at conversation. Maybe it was a bad day for her. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Carpets in the hall looked well worn and in need of replacement. I was seriously annoyed that they charge for WiFi access. Breakfast was pretty good, but wasn't the best I had on this trip. I would stay here again, but I might be tempted to look for a hotel on the south side of the river - and one with FREE WiFi. It would all depend on the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: sjdmd
Reviews.Content: We were on a tour as were most of the hotel guests which made the lines at the breakfast buffett terrible on most of the days we were there. The breakfast is only fair and often ran out of food. The rooms were small, tired and worn. The hotel stafff was marginally helpful. The hotel was in a good location for walking to many sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--good location”
Reviews.Author: K-boy
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group that stayed 3 nights in this hotel in the Prati district of Rome. That is just north of Castle Saint Angelo and the palace of Justice. Our group was over 50 people and they got us situated and our luggage off the bus and into our rooms relatively quick. The front desk was OK, could have been a little more friendly. The lobby bar is nice but like all hotel bars a little expensive. The breakfast was very good and offered more than just rolls and coffee. The location is great if you are mainly interested in the Vatican and St Peters. It's also only a short walk to the Piazza del Popolo. This is a very nice plaza with 3 churches one of which (Santa Maria del Popolo) has 2 Caravagio paintings. The view from the Pincio is spectacular. From there, it's a short walk to the Spanish Steps. The hotel seems to cater to groups as there were several there. It's a larger hotel and groups do require a lot of rooms. I'm not sure of the price because it was included in the trip. If I was on my own, I would opt for a smaller, cheaper hotel as you spend so little time in your room when there is all of Rome to see. If your group has booked here, you will be fine. The rooms facing the street are a little noisey. The air conditioning was fine as it is up and running in June. The controls take a few minutes to figure out. Room safe, nice bath, all the regular stuff. Heard some complaints about the internet availability, but we didn't use it. This hotel is not convenient to the forum or coliseum as they are a taxi ride for sure. All in all, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “First-rate”
Reviews.Author: JaimeFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cicerone is a first-rate hotel located within walking distance of the Vatican and Castel Sant'Angelo and a number of good restaurants. The hotel serves an excellent breakfast, the rooms are well maintained and the furnishings and bathroom area very clean. The hotel staff is courteous and fluent in two or more languages. We will certainly stay at the Hotel Cicerone during our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but would probably stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: As many others have stated, the location is great so if you are only in Rome for a few days this is probably worth your stay. If you are staying longer than you may want to consider other hotels. We found this to be mixed - bartender very nice, front desk not so, bellhop very nice, waitress not so, etc. I wouldn't recommend eating here as other options nearby are better choices, but for a decent place to stay in Rome this wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoilerMakerBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cicerone twice, once for three nights at the beginning of a two week pilgrimage trip and then again on the last night before leaving to come home. The first room was outstanding in every way! The second, not so much. The first, everything worked, we had a nice view and lots of space. The second, the A/C didn't work, the room was small and our view was the center courtyard. That having been said, the location is fabulous - just a few blocks walk from the Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Navonne, and Testevere. About four blocks walk to the nearest subway station. But we're walkers! We did not have our laptop with us but friends who did were never able to get on the hotels WiFi. The TV Based system didn't seem to work for friends & was pricey. So we found an internet site about a mile away (quite close to the Vatican Museum entrance) which worked OK. The breakfasts were quite nice - we are cereal, fruit, and croissant (my weakness) people and all were fine. The bar was well stocked but pricey. The shopping area just a block north of the hotel offered a wide variety of choices. A little pizzaria - the San Marco is a short walk and offers excellent food for a very reasonable price. Their pizza Margherita was excellent as was the house white wine. I would definitely stay at this hotel again (assuming I could afford it ;-)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION - BUT ROCK HARD PILLOWS/BED”
Reviews.Author: slinky58
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location - very clean - bathrooms were spotless - but the pillows & bed were rock hard. Not sure what I paid bc it was included in a Globus Tour package.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Butch42
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from the port and our room was ready. The staff was extremely helpful in finding places to eat and in repairing a broken pair of glasses. The room was large and air conditioned. It was located within walking distance of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: wy123traveler
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package from our cruise for the day after in Rome. From the internet information, the Cicerone Hotel looked very nice and we agreed to pay the large fee for the six of us to stay there for one night. The location is very good. You are near the Vatican and can walk to the northern tourist spots easily. The property is run down. The rooms are shabby, The bed was very uncomfortable. I asked about getting a cup of hot water for tea and was told that it was not possible! For what we paid to stay here, we did not recieve good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “good location for Vatican visitors”
Reviews.Author: twominks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with on tour for independent travelers. We enjoyed the area; able to walk to Vatican and several bars & eateries near by.Restorante Pi Bus also available across the street & subway a few blocks away. Room was good size for Italy. Our view was the back side of the buildings but we don't spend much time in our room. Clean and neat. Maid service great and very friendly staff. The breakfast buffett was very good, the best we had in Italy. Ristorante Pizzeria Bisteccheria near by has great food, and opened early for those who do not want to dine late. We took a private tour of the Vatican (after a group tour) with Walks of Italy (www.walksofitaly.com) and it was very much worth the cost. Ask for Tyson as your guide.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, but a great martini”
Reviews.Author: 17Rams
Reviews.Content: The room that 3 of us shared was a bit cremaped, but the breakfast was very good, and the bartender made a great martini for our pre-dinner cocktail. The hotel was centrally located and relatively convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Idea Of 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Zsiga
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and clean. At first glance the bathroom looked lovely, but at closer inspection the toilet paper holder was broken and the glass shield around the tub was poorly installed so the floor around the tub was flooded every time we took a shower. The hair dryer was in vey bad shape and it took a lot of complaining on our part to get a new one. The bathrooms in the lobby are missing hand dryers or towels. Breakfast was acceptable and staff were willing to go out of their way to please. Air-conditioning was non existent one night and iffy on a few others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Saippuakupla
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with my mother and my friend, and we had a lovely time there! Very friendly hotel personal at the reseption - all our questions were answered quickly and allways very politely and with a smile. Our flight was leaving late at night so we left our luggage at the hotel after checking out and it worked just fine. The rooms we were staying in were nicely spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Just slightly outdated, spesially the bathrooms, but we aren't huge fans of everything modern so we could live with that. I have to mention that rooms facing the street are just a little bit noisier and have no balcony, the other side rooms had the balconies but there was really not much to see from them and if the balcony door was left open I could hear the noise from the brekfast area in the morning. Breakfast buffet was amazing - lot's of variety and we found everything we wanted! The location of the hotel was good, within a walking distance from all the main attractions of Rome and the city centre with lots and lots of restaurants. It was much more quiet and peaceful on the left side of the river during the night time so we got to sleep really well! Also the metro station was quite close to the hotel. The internet was unfortunatly not free so we had to buy a time ticket to use it in the lobby, but it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “OK but housekeeping could be better”
Reviews.Author: historyjak
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel just a walk away from the Vatican. Good concierge and nice lobby. Breakfast was good. The thing that struck me was the dirtiness of some aspects. All the curtains could have done with a wash, which was most noticeable with the voile curtains in the room which were positively grey at the tops. There were also grey streaks across the ceiling. The sheets and pillowcases were very good quality but had holes, as did the blackout curtain. The curtains in the lobby were also past their sell-by date. It was a good hotel, but could have been better with more attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: gbw1231
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Cicerone Hotel for three nights before our eleven night cruise. We were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of most of the main attractions in Rome. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly with every request we made. We requested a better than standard room at check-in since we were cebrating our anniversary. We were pleased to find the room we were assigned was a little larger than standard but more importantly was at the end of the hallway and facing the courtyard. The street could be quite busy and noisy. We didn't try the restaurant because there were so many small local restaurants within a couple of blocks. The buffet breakfast was good and a quick way to get your day started . The concierge was very helpful with scheduling tours and answering any questions we had. Overall we would recommend this hotel for it's location, efficiency and price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryamzz
Reviews.Content: room was OK , but restaurant (where we ate breakfast )was not comfortable. location was good it's near Vatican and Sant angelo

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one!”
Reviews.Author: Eden_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: The elevator goes to the 7th floor but our room is on the 8th floor? Yes, just for you, you get to hoof it up a flight of stairs to get to your room. Did I mention that the heat doesn't turn off and the air conditioning doesn't come on until the entire hotel switches gears? Who knows when that is - who cares - it was an oven when we stayed there. We opened our screenless windows to cool the room down. Did we sleep well knowing our windows were open and we were located on a flat roof top? How about that noise all night long...would you get any sleep? It was cooler in the hallway than our room but we just couldn't bring ourselves to camping in the hallway. The "concierge" couldn't help me locate a street address where I was to meet a Vatican tour group and I believe the internet access was not free. The employees behind the counter seemed to be annoyed whenever you stood there waiting to be helped. All this, my fellow travelers, and you paid a lot of money for it also! Oh, and it seemed to be filled with American touristas - there was no expresso or capucino at breakfast and the breakfast buffet was boring, boring, boring. (the coffee was awful, the hotel is ancient)

Reviews.Title: “Stifling hot room, like a sauna”
Reviews.Author: dgc19522001
Reviews.Content: Room 745 in the Cicerone (and perhaps others) is like a sauna if the temperature is over 50. The answer is," turn off the heat and open the window. There is no air conditioning in Italy until May". We are smart enough to know to turn off the heat! We opened the window and the curtains in the hope of getting a tiny breeze (which over looks a courtyard, so we sacrificed privacy). It was a sweat box at any time, day or night. This is a sophisticated, busy hotel and there is no excuse for them not finding a solution to this problem, even if it means turning on the a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lgatz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights at the Cicerone Hotel while joining a tour group in Rome. We found the hotel nicely located for us, we don't mind walking. We were with in walking distance to most of the sights that we wanted to see. The hotel rooms were good sized for a large city. No air conditioning yet, which was a bit uncomfortable for us as we are from Maine. We couldn't leave the windows open at night as we were right above the a busy street and it was fairly noisey. My only complaint was that there was black mold growing in the bathroom tub/shower, other than that, we found the room very clean. We should have asked for more pillows as ours were very flat.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KattyEngland
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and had everything we needed but was quite basic. The breakfast was ok but there wasn't a huge amount of choice. The location was good, within walking distance of the vatican and the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Loubielou72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for my Dad's 60th birthday celebrations. There were 9 in our party including my 8 year old daughter. Our room ( triple) was reasonably spacious but absolutely nothing like the rooms represented on the website - they were very basic a certainly not 4 star. My parents booked the superior double- on arrival were told there was no double and they would need a twin,the room was more basic than ours, very small and the air con blew out hot air and would not turn off, leaving their room like an oven! They were eventually moved the second day after being told several times that their room was indeed a superior although clearley it wasn't.The pillows were so thin and we only had one each- when we requested extra we were told there weren't any, along with no hairdryer or iron. Breakfast was good but very basic and we had to go elsewhere on the first morning as the queue was up two flights of stairs! Overall I was very dissapointed with the hotel. My parents paid almost £2000 for this accommodation and I would not reccommend it to anyone....they seem more interested on how many people they can squeeze in rather than offering good service

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: aitenshi
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good location, within walking distance to St. Peter's Square & Castel de San Angelo. Hotel room was very clean. Good buffet breakfast selection. Reception staff efficient. Restaurants, ATMs and shops nearby. Has a bar that opens til late. Negatives: Room I stayed in was directly opposite the lifts and front windows faced out onto the street so it got a bit noisy. I could hear the traffic on the street and people outside waiting for lift. However, other friends had rooms towards back of the hotel away from the street and lifts so their rooms were very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: jcl88
Reviews.Content: The Cicerone is fine and clean, but with limited or dated facilities. The buffet breakfast can be busy, but there is a 4 hour window to pick your time. An idea is to go to the Vatican early, St Peter's opens at 7, and come back for breakfast, to aviod queues at each. The bar is dreary bling, and avoid the Roman house wine on offer. The SIT shuttle bus from Fiumicino stops at the Piazza Cavour, only 3 mins from hotel. It is 15 euros return. The best restaurants are over the river (Ponte Cavour), such as Gusto and Il Leoncino.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel grteat location near vatican”
Reviews.Author: frenchyglasgow
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the cicerone hotel and found the hotel very clean rooms changed daily only slight thing was the noise of traffic early in morning but not that bad we found the hotel bar very expensive at 5 euros for a small beer when you can go over the road take a right turn then first left to the despar shop where a bigger bottles off beer will set u back 1euro 30 and they are cold as well all in all we had a great time we did not use the tours to beat the lines for the vatican we stood in line and it only took 15 mins and the que was half way round the square i would recomend this hotel as it is very close to all rome attractions we walked everyware and it only took us 50 mins to walk to the colliseum just make sure you take the map the hotel gives you or you might get lost the hotel also gives a very good breakfast eat as much as you want

Reviews.Title: “A nice base of operations”
Reviews.Author: liam_0
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at this hotel for seven nights, we were on the fourth floor overlooking the road at the front of the hotel. We used this as a place to sleep and rest mainly, we would go out in the morning after breakfast, come back for a siesta during the afternoon then go out again in the evening. We would often use the hotel bar in the evening which was very pleasent with a nice selection of drinks. In general, the staff were a little rude but there were some exception i.e. the bar staff. The bed was comfortable and both my partner and myself slept soundly each and every night. The bathroom was smart and clean. There was one incident when someone came into our room while I was in the shower and my partner was reading a book in the window, neither of us saw who this person was but they left immediatly after opening the door. The breakfast in the morning was great, there was a large selection of food items and drinks. The best time to turn up for breakfast is early, I found that the best service was had during this time, the staff were friendly and the buffet table was filled. When I went down to breakfast later (towards the end of the alloted breakfasted time) it was alot busier and the staff were rushing around and looked quite pressured. The breakfast room is large but it would be impossible to fit all the guest in there at once, so going early would be best. The hotel is very close to the vatican and not far to walk for several other sites but the walk to the colosseum seemed to take forever. The restuarant accross the road from the hotel was great, I can't remember it's exact name but i know it was blue something or something blue, in italian though so azzurro something or something azzurro. During the summer months there are several restaurants and bar type things along the river tiber, just below the castel saint angelo and the building that seemed to be some sort of court. One I enjoyed in particular is T-bone station, although not very italian it was very nice and in a great location, I went about three or four times. If there was one bad point I would pick the following out. In order to get to rome we took two flights and as a result our baggage was late, I told the people at the reception that I was expecting luggage, when it arrived at the hotel the rang my room and bought the luggage up which would be great if it was not 0230 in the morning, I would of preferred them to keep the luggage until the morning and either rang me after 0600 or brought it up when they come to clean the room. In conclusion it was a great hotel in a great location, my partner and myself are returning to the same hotel again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Arturo46
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Italy, so we booked all reservations through a recommended travel agent. When I checked on Trip Advisor, I was not so sure she made the right choice for Rome. I was wrong, she was right. First of all, so many posts here complain about the 'star' ratings, i.e. "not a 4 star hotel". In my opinion, if the hotel is clean, quiet, comfortable, affordable, and in a great location, then it can be rated zero stars and still be my top choice. Hotel is located in the Vatican section of Rome, but other areas are vey accessible through either walking, taxi (5-10 Euros each way), or the marvelous (and cheap) Rome subway system a few blocks away. As stated before, the room was perfectly fine: clean and comfortable - bath was spotless. With so much sightseeing to do, all you really need is such a place to 'crash' after a busy day. We had no complaints at all with the staff - very friendly and helpful with directions. If you want an enormous room with a wonderful view and a staff that fawns over you, then this is not your hotel. My wife and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I would try another establishment”
Reviews.Author: Kongsi-INFO
Reviews.Content: It is supposed to be a 4 stars hotel, but I would only rate it 3 stars. Rooms is a bit small, the double-bed came with 2 very flat pillows (instead of 4), carpet were ragged and the sound-proofing is inadequate. We stayed on the 4th Floor facing the main road (Via Cicerone) for 3 nights, we could hear people conversations from the road even when all the windows were tightly closed. We did not have a good night sleep. No coffee/tea making facility in the room, hence, we could not have a glass of warm water during the cold nights. We can't find the room service menu in the room, so we are not sure if they have room service! Old and small 21" television in the room. Definitely not an enjoyable stay. However, it is located very near to the shopping street of Via Cola Di Rienzo (not for designer goods but the average price products). I would however recommend the restaurant directly opposite the hotel. I could not remember the name but it served good Italian/Sicilian cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cymro36
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel for one night twenty years ago and was happy to return for a three-night stay with my wife. It is very conveniently situated - a 15-minute walk to the Vatican even at our senior citizen pace! Castel Sant' Angelo is just around the corner and Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and other historic sites just a short walk on the other side of the Tiber. The hotel provides a very good buffet breakfast and there is a restaurant which provides a set 3-course meal for 25 euros with an a-la-carte alternative. There is also a selection of other places to eat very close to the hotel. The bedroom could have been slightly larger but was generally adequate and there was no traffic noise. The only real criticism was that we each had only one flattish pillow which reduced our sleep quality. Just a word of warning - whereas the hotel's website says that the taxi fare from Fiumicino Airport is a fixed 40 euros, the fare is actually 60 euros and this is stated on a notice at the airport's taxi rank. Apart from that, this hotel provided us with a thoroughly enjoyable short break.

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone Please renovate your rooms!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cicerone in 2004 as a part of our Globus tour of Italy and loved it, our room was very high end and classy and we thought the location was ideal. So in sept 2010 we stayed her pre-cruise as we took a 20 night mediterrean cruise out of Rome and omg we're we ever dissapointed. I'm fluent in Italian and made sure our res was all good and they knew me by name by the time we checked in. This time our room was very very run down, old moldy tile in the bathroom, paint peeling off the wall, old gold and blue duvet that looked like the same material of my great grandmother 100 year old drapes, carpet very wore out and torn and the matteress was hard and woke up with a very sore back. They offered free breakfast and omg i could not beleive how rude this older man who is a bus boy at the cicerone was has a very dirty look on his face even though i smiled at him and said hello would not crack a smile, i do remember him from 2004 and he was rude back then too and cant beleive he is still employed there. There was another waitress there that was very rude as well. The location was great, we love the pizza place across the street (grotta azzura) just amazing pizza!!, but Cicerone come on now!! you really need to renovate your rooms, change your matteress update the bathrooms and change the carpet and bedding and re-paint!!. We will not stay here again as its really not worth the money at all untill they renovate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: tickettotravelagency
Reviews.Content: my wife and I had a room with mold and mildew for 5 nts, This hotel has a total disregard for the safety and security of their guests. ANYONE can walk off the street for a free breakfast or ask for a duplicate key to a room without being asked for id; maids, the only friendly staff, will open any door when asked not knowing if that person belongs in there; I know this to be fact as we had several in our group of 52 who requested duplicate keys or had rooms opened. The restaurant has no staff checking names or id of those entering . My wife's bag was stolen right from under us while we were seated with 2 other friends. We reported the incident to the front desk and were told "it was the Gypsies", apparently this was not a first. We had to file a police report (which is a joke in Italy)as required by the hotel's insurance. We have never heard from their insurance despite numerous emails to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oliv86
Reviews.Content: The greatest area if you want to explore Rome.Near to metro station and only 10min walking to Vaticano and his museums.Many good restaurants around but to find them you have to explore the small streets(there aren't restaurants at the main street). The room was very noisy(mine was from the side of the main street)and not so clean. The Breakfast was great and with variety.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: JHS_Boston
Reviews.Content: I was pretty worried about this hotel from skimming the reviews here, but it was perfectly OK, even a bit better than OK. It is clearly a big group tour hotel, and we were there through a booking agency, but not as part of a tour. Our rooms (a double and a triple) were clean and comfortable. Not luxurious, but not Motel 6 quality either by a long shot. The bathroom was clean and the facilities all worked well. I especially liked the bright bedside lights. After a week touring Italy where the reading lights were so dim it was hard to read, I appreciated the light by the bed. The wireless internet is grossly overpriced at 17 euro for 24 hours, but at least it worked well for us, with no problems mentioned by another reviewer. The breakfast was plentiful and varied, but not terribly exciting. Very typical of Italian hotel breakfast buffets. The espresso was much better than the watered down coffee, just ask for it. The croissants were sweet and bready (why is it impossible to find a crisp croissant in all of Italy?), and the eggs were reasonable, for hotel scrambled steamtable eggs. However, the very best, and I mean BEST thing about the Cicerone Hotel is that it is around the corner from Al Palazzaccio, a trattoria with really good food, pleasant staff, not expensive, just really tasty. We had some of our best simple meals there. There's a reason that it fills up as soon as it opens. Go at 7 PM, get seated immediately and get 15% off your bill (their "happy dinner time"), or wait until 7:30 and wait an hour for a table. Just go! Via Ennio Quirino Visconti 66-68.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Cheerful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SWilliamsoninVA
Reviews.Content: We found the Cicerone to be clean with a cheerful staff. Our room was spotless and comfortable. The breakfast was good and plentiful. The location was in walking distance (for us) to alot of the attractions, very centrally located. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SJK1358
Reviews.Content: Stayed with part of a large tour, staff was almost considered rude. They wont look at you and say hello, thank you, etc. Our toilet was broke for over 8 hours and I had to ask 3 times to have it repaired. Reported it at 2:00 PM, wasnt fixed until 9:00PM. The restaurant satff could not handle the size of our tour and the lines for breakfast were ridiculous. My advise....find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality hotel, reasonably near to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: fair1Bolton
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel pre cruise and it seemed good value for money to us. We travelled on 21/11 so maybe the hotel was a bit less busy. Must thank the earlier reviewer ( Holly i think) who recommended the nearby restaurant Al Palazzaccio. We ate there both nights of our stay- Could get a good meal with good quality house wine for a really reasonable price for Rome. Room- was clean, with wooden floors, toiletries and reasonably quiet ( as we had requested) being at the side of the building. Location- it was a pleasant 15minute walk to St Peters Square and the vatican musuem Breakfast- was fine for this standard hotel, got our tea/coffee within a couple of minutes of ordering both days. Reception- found them professional but not involved- would not have been confident of their interest if we found ourselves in any difficulties . All in all we'd never been to Rome before and felt we could have done much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: childsy442
Reviews.Content: We found the front of house staff 'aloof bordering on rude and arrogant. The breakfast were nothing to get excited about, the wait staff in the dining room seemed to be under great pressure, at one breakfast we did not recieve tea or coffee even after asking staff several times. Our first night there was a party going on in the downstairs bar with loud music which could be heard in our 1st floor room quite clearly. we would not recommened this hotel to our frends.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: Holly_82
Reviews.Content: To summarise – I would recommend this hotel, however I felt there were quite a few ‘frustrations’ with the place, so if possible, I’d give it 3.5 out of 5. We arrived at about 8:30pm and checked in straight away. The check in staff were polite and helpful and gave us a map of Rome which we used every day. My room was on the end of a corridor and I seemed to have been upgraded as my room was twice the size of my friends room (we booked at the same time). The room was mostly clean and tidy, lots of toiletries, fresh towels etc. The ‘niggles’ were - Few hairs in the bath - My bath didn’t have a plug, so I couldn’t have a bath - Slight mould in the corner of the bath (see photo) - Shower head had limescale on it. - Bed covers were a single blanket and I got quite cold in the night None of it was ‘hotels from hell’ and if there had been a spare blanket in the cupboard, mould and hair wasn’t there, I would have said the room was spotless. As it was on a main road, it was quite noisy if you kept the window open, but once shut, it wasn’t too bad at all. Breakfast was perfectly adequate and nice – You got a good selection of pastries, meats etc – sadly on the second day the waiter seemed to forget my cup of tea and as I wasn’t a coffee drinker, I wasn’t able to have a caffeine fix! So again, a ‘niggle’. The lifts didn’t seem to work very well, we stood on the ground floor for 3 minutes and pressed the button – nothing. It said the lift was on the 1st floor, so we walked up the stairs, pressed the button and the lift opened automatically... so, it seemed as if the buttons on the ground floor to call the lift were intermittently working. We didn’t eat at the restaurant in the evening, but for lunch one day, we found the most AMAZING cafe 30 seconds walk from the hotel called Al Palazzaccio (see photo) which served the BEST pasta I have ever eaten and the waiters were brilliant. It was also quite cheap (8 euros for pasta) so would thoroughly recommend the cafe. My friend bought the movie and internet package for 14 Euros for 24 hours, sadly the internet connection wasn’t great and half way through the movie, the TV reset itself... so another ‘niggle’ He managed to sort it out after 10 minutes, but you don’t really want to be interrupted half way through a movie! It sounds a lot of ‘bad’ things, but none of it made our holiday horrible and we loved Rome. The hotel is very conveniently located and we managed to get from the airport for 15 Euros by taking the train to Rome termini (14 Euros) and taking the metro to Lepanto which cost 1 Euro as we got a 75 minute valid ticket. We did the same on the way back so it was much cheaper than a taxi. The hotel happily kept our luggage until we collected it, check out was absolutely fine and the concierge service was great. If the hotel sorted out all the small issues, I’d quite happily give it 5/5 and even then, I would stay at this hotel again as there is nothing too bad about it – I just don’t know whether you’d get better service at another hotel for the same amount of money as it wasn’t all that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cicerone--Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stretch2054
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and the location is great in Rome. It is close to the Vatican, Plazza del Popolo, Borghese Gallery, and the old section of the city where the Pantheon is located.

Reviews.Title: “Smart efficient hotel not far from St.Peter's Piazza”
Reviews.Author: Peter2305
Reviews.Content: This 4-star hotel in central Rome is excellent and well-run although our Page & Moy party of 45 people were only staying for 3 nights. Large lobby area with lifts either end. Comfortable bar area. Porterage of luggage was provided. Our good sized room on the 2nd floor was very comfortable and the bathroom excellent and spotless. Air conditioning worked, thank goodness as it was Hot! The breakfast is styled “American” with bacon, scrambled eggs and frankfurter sausages plus a limitless array of other food, but the same every day. There were no toast-making facilities. The coffee was not freshly made and a jug was simply brought from a side table and was just awful. Why can’t the Italians master the art of HOT drinks?? Tea consisted of a jug of hot water and a tea bag. Lots of coach parties stay here and the breakfast room can get very congested if they are going on an early tour, so leave it until a bit later to go in for breakfast. Plenty of restaurants nearby, not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Hotel - Exceptional Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: wally046
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago on the advice of our travel agent. Given the mediocre reviews on TA, concern was mounting. As it turns out, things turned out quite different from the negative reviews posted here, First of all, the room and bathroom were very clean, no mold to be seen. Room was cleaned at least once daily. A/C worked well, beds were comfortable. Breakfast buffet was similar to other hotels we stayed at in Italy: heavy on pastries with watered down coffee - ask for a double expresso or 2. Location of hotel is convenient to Vatican area sites as well as sites across the river. We used mass transit to get to Coliseum, Spanish Steps,Trevi and other galleries and churches. Bus is very close by and subway is about a 2 1/2 block walk. Before the trip, I had not planned on using mass transit, but the convenience of it outweighed any negatives. Some subway cars look like the 1970's NYC subways with graffiti covering the entire cars, while others were spotless. Just ask the front desk for the correct bus numbers to take. The subway has maybe 20-30 stops total, so it's almost impossible to get lost. Front desk staff was over-the-top helpful in straightening out some gallery reservations WE had messed up in Florence. They stayed on the line, on hold, for over 20 minutes and resolved our mistakes. Great Job! For an in-depth review of Rome dining, check out this critique on Chowhound.com: http://chowhound.chow.com/topics/563870?tag=search_results;results_list

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: MaxGS
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Cicerone for the second time in September 2010 for a 5-night stay. Our previous stay was in 2008 and the hotel had made a good impression with the only minus being that it is a bit off the historic city center, on the other side of the Tiber. As we were unable to find a more centrally located hotel with satifactory reviews at the same price range, we returned to the Cicerone and were not disappointed. Our rooms were of adequate size and the beds comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and clean with plentiful hot water. The air conditioning was working and units in each room could be turned on and off individually. The selection at breakfast was good, although we surprised to see that quite a lot of the cups were cracked or broken, which the staff seemed not to notice. Although most members of staff were attentive and the staff at reception was helpful and spoke English, some of the staff at breakfast could have been more courteous. The hotel restaurant was excellent. Room service was available but not on Sundays, which was a bit frustrating. The sight nearest to the hotel is Castel Sant Angelo, a 5-minute walk away. From there it takes about 10 to 15 minutes to walk to St. Peter at the Vatican. Piazza del Popolo is about 15 to 20 minutes' walk in the opposite direction across the Tiber. There is a bus terminal and a taxi rank in piazza Cavour which is less than 5 minutes walk away; and if you cannot walk that far, staff at the hotel's reception can call a taxi to pick you up at the hotel's entrance (but this makes the taxi ride a bit more expensive). The hotel can also arrange for a car to drive you to Fumicino airport for a price of EUR 55 (we were 4 persons with 5 pieces of laguage). Overall, we were happy with our stay at Cicerone and would probably stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, great location, efficient staff, good VFM”
Reviews.Author: obanknights
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 day trip to Rome. Selected the Cicerone Hotel after reading reviews on TA. My experience was excellent. We stayed in a twin room which was an adequate size for 2 burly Scotsmen. The room was spotless and I couldn't fault the decor. We left the air-con on during the day and the room was nice and cool when we returned each night. Our room was to the front of the hotel (No.618) and we experienced very little (if any) traffic noise so a sound sleep was had (despite my brother's snoring!). The hotel common areas were great and the staff generally friendly and efficient. The bar staff were particularly efficient and attentive. Piano player in the evening gave a nice backdrop. Great location, 10mins leisurely walk to the St Peter’s Square nicely interspersed with loads of shops. In the opposite direction, 10-15mins walk to the Spanish Steps which was vibrant all day and night. Also, convenient for city sightseeing bus stop at St Peter’s Square. We booked a private taxi transfer from Rome Ciampino airport (55euros each way) and were pleasantly surprised to be collected by a large Mercedes upon arrival and a Jaguar for the return journey. This prevented the hassle of negotiating with unscrupulous airport taxis or travelling by bus to Termini followed by another taxi across town (45mins door to door excellent!). I would definitely recommend this hotel to any first time traveller to the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: saminmit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not a 4 star hotel. The location is good but the staff are unfriendly and unhelpful. The breakfast was average. They charged 17 euros for wireless internet but the code didn't work and when trying to resolve the matter they said they can't help us. Also, when we asked for some hot water or a coffee maker at night they said that it was impossible. Our air conditioning was also broken and they said they would send someone up to fix it but it was never fixed and we were sweating for 4 days in a row.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rod_newland
Reviews.Content: jusy got back from a weeks stay at this hotel and i do not rate it as 4 star.it needs a refit our room 607 had a very dirty carpet with a lot of stains on it, there was also a big stain on the ceiling and the wallpaper was marked and dirty.the staff were very friendly and helpful the buffet breakfast was ok but boring and they could not make tea or coffee with hot water. i would not stay here again. rod from cornwall

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great. Adequate for 2 nights.”
Reviews.Author: tokyo503
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 13:00 we were told our room would be ready in 30 minutes; 20 minutes later were told it would be ready in an hour. No apologies - no nothing -- that's the way it is. Hopeless welcome! However, everything else about the hotel was okay. Rooms were clean and functional. No free Wifi - it costs EUR 9 per 24 hours. Buffet breakfast had an excellent selection but staff was snotty when I asked for an additional table setting which was needed. But overall this hotel was not bad value for money, and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: hannatam44
Reviews.Content: This location was great! It is close to the Vatican as well as the Spanish Steps and Piazza Navone and the famous Fontana det Trevi. The American breakfast buffet was OK, but it was same thing everyday. I expected some variety from 4star hotel . They don't change the sheets for a whole week we stayd there. The staff were very professional but I missed the friendliness except Giuliana she was very friendly and answered with a smile. For Swidish Tourist!!one of the Staff with name "Rosita" is from Sweden take advantage of that oppurtunity if you have probelm with english, she is very nice. Tips!!!If you want to go to the beach then I would recommend you to take the train the red line towards Termini then ask for il Trenino towards Ostia di Lido. The best beach is on Stella Polare. there are very nice places but it will cost you between 8-10 EUR for Entry + sunbed and Umbrella . or do as we did take the free beach you dont need to pay anything for Entry. we paid ¨5 EUR only for sun chair with little Umbrella mounted on the sun bed "two in one". Ask the livewatcher at the beach he is the one who rent them. it will take about 35 minutes to reach the station Stella Polare with the train. and it is very cheap and save to take train in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We are so very thankful”
Reviews.Author: lori730
Reviews.Content: We felt like we just had to comment on on recent stay at the Cicerone Hotel. Due to a brief medical set back my spouse had to make a detour to a Rome Hospital during our stay at the Cicerone. ALL of the staff, were so extremely helpful and resourceful for us. They really went above and beyond to help us navigate a difficult time. From coordinating taxi's to the hospital and translating hospital documents and helping with translation via phone to the hospital even very late at night and helping us with on line arrangements for the airport and customizing our airport transport. The entire front desk, reception & concierge are in very high regard in our opinions. We also were pleased with our hotel rooms, clean comfortable and even cool. Something that was highly appreciated during our extremely hot weather visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Note really a 4 star but still nicer than many others”
Reviews.Author: PNWsailor
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel. Nice sized room, clean and confortable. The breakfast buffet was good. The hotel is located in a very nice area to be in. Easy walk to major attractions and good local neighbourhood resturants. Disposable plastic cups, no wine glasses in the room don't allow this to turly be a 4 star hotel, but it is still superior to many others. We had some problems with the tour company that booked us and the hotel worked to get everything cleared up and in order. Great staff that speak english.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: trajanspqr
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Cicerone for a week and had no complaints. Two rooms, two people to a room. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We didn't discover until we checked out that our rooms had honor bars. Before booking, I read a complaint or two that the rooms were hot. We like it cold and when we turned the AC down we could see our breaths. No problem there. The breakfast is great, but occasionally large tour groups created some congestion. The staff was helpful and accomodating. They called cabs, booked tours and answered our questions with a snile. The location is great. St Peter's is a short walk and the Pantheon is not much further. Lots of good restauarnts nearby too. There is a tiny business center that can sccomodate one guest at a time, but it never seemed to be occupied. Each time I used it, it was available. We'll come back to the Cicerone.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE AND BEST LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: HenriqueJorge
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that me and wife stayed at the Cicerone, and we are ready to return as often as we land in Rome. The location is superb, specially because it's very close to major atractions in town but still secluded in a very residential area, not too turisty and off the beaten track, but if you want trendy restaurants and boutiques, everything stands at a stone throw. The rooms are confortable, clean and confortable. The beds are confy and bathrooms toileteries surprisingly nice. The staff tends to be very busy, but try a little italian and they will open their hearts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, knowledgeable concierge, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelinfoolFlorida
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Cicerone Hotel was great for a solo female traveler. I felt very safe in this area of Rome both during the day and at night. However, it is also advisable for couples or couples with older children. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the Vatican and St. Angelo's Castle. You can cross the bridge in front of the castle and catch a hop on/hop off bus on the street corner for a 2 hour ride through the city. The concierge is fantastic. He will make excellent recommendations for restaurants and for shopping, depending on your budget. Also, he is very willing to call a cab for a quick ride to any desired location. My only complaint was the fairly small size of my hotel room, but the bathroom was average size. However, that would not stop me from staying here again as I did not go to Rome to stay in my room.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: kleppner
Reviews.Content: cicerone has a very good location, a twenty minutes walk to the spanish steps (with stroller), it had a very nice breakfast but the service is a little slow but overall a good experience. there are a couple of good italian restaurants around. the hop on hop off tours also have pick up points nearby. there is an underground 5 min away. some members of the staff were really helpfull. overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: princess1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The rooms were a decent size. Most of the staff was extremely friendly except one woman. The breakfast was nice. They offered a variety of foods. They had scrambled eggs and bacon along with a ton of pasties and yogurt. The hotel was within a 20 minute walk of most of the best sites. They offered Internet and the prices varied. We paid $17 euros for 24 hours and having brought our laptop we could use it in our room. They also offered Internet down in the lobby for about the same price. This was quietest room (hotel) of all that we had on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in the details”
Reviews.Author: karojisatsu
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 7 nights at the Cicerone Hotel. To be fair, it was safe, relatively quiet and the location was reasonable. The breakfast buffet was good, even though it was exactly the same day after day. And I must mention Marcello, the concierge who was outstanding. That is where it ends. The remainder of the front desk staff were cool, at best. The carpets were dirty and frayed. The woodwork was chipped and dirty. The faucet in the sink was disgusting. The amenities were nominal.
