There was not even a holder for the toilet paper. The food and the attitude of the staff in the restaurant were mediocre. The daily fee for internet was outrageous. There was no free WIFI anywhere, not even in the lobby. They charge to use the computer printer in the lobby. This is NOT at all what I expected for the price and their supposed rating.

Reviews.Title: “A decent Hotel, in a reasonable location, in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: the_cadmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as part of a two night pre-cruise stay, before boarding a cruise. The Hotel was adequate, but not sparkling, the rooms were clean and reasonable, but the bar area and buffet breakfast were not as good. The location was pretty good, with just a 5 or 10 minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peters Sq and in the other direction a 15 minutes walk to the shopping, eating and drinking areas. The colleseum, Forum and Spanish Steps are a bit of a long walk from the Hotel, but it was Rome that really shone, with so much to see and do, we really did have a busy two days fitting as much as we could in. A decent Hotel, at good value, but there are probably better in terms of quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kaptrb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for three nights in the end of February 2010. When me and my friends arrived, we were told that the one of the two rooms with double bed that we had booked was not ready and would be ready in 1,5 hour! That changed our plans for the first day of our visit to Rome. We asked if we could go to another room temporarily and then go to the room with the double bed, but they said it was not possible...so we had to leave our luggage to the one room, go out and be back after two hours. Both of the rooms that we were given did not have double bed, but two single and joined beds. Apart from that, the rooms and bathrooms had enough space for two and they were cleaned very well every day, but the decoration seemed a little old. The hotel is in a very good location, 5min walk from metro station and 10 min walk from city center. The breakfast was good, but the one day we could not find a table for four people. I recommend this hotel, but do not have very high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Service was hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: golden190
Reviews.Content: Make friends with the bartenders, they will treat you right. That was the best part of my stay. Lots of tour groups and cruise goers stay here. Hotel was pretty outdated by American standards. Not much charm either. The concierge was helpful at times but others seemed bothered. What I did like about the neighborhood surrounding the hotel was it was not as touristy as some parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely disappointing and one to avoid”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithTeens42
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, this is NOT the place to stay. Although rated as a four star hotel, we found it lacked even the class and charm of a normal three star lodging. The beds were the most uncomfortable we have ever slept in--anywhere. Service was not good and the front desk never answered the phone. None of the hotel departments would pick up calls making it difficult to get any information, room service etc. This is a large property that caters to tour groups which may explain the tepid coffee at breakfast and the lack of genuine customer service. We spent over $500 per night USD for two rooms and did not feel this property was worth half the price. Avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, comfortable, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: horganova
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and friends recently and arrived early for check in, 11am to be exact. No trouble, we were allocated our rooms immediately and able to go out to immerse ourselves in the beauty and culture that is Rome. Staff were most helpfull and the attention to each request and question was efficient and most helpful. Breakfast was good too and our rooms were most comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Polkalady
Reviews.Content: Stayed following a Mediterranean cruise. Great location near the Vatican with good restaurants and shopping close by. The Pizzeria San Marco a couple of blocks away was wonderfu. The hotel is what you would expect of a 4 star hotel. Good service from the reception and concierge staff. Would ask for a room in the back. The front can be noisy if you elect to open the windows. The beds to tend to be on the firm side. All in all, good value for location and services provided.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay marred by poor aftercare”
Reviews.Author: BettyBoo2u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located and of a reasonable standard. The buffet breakfast was a good start to the day and the rooms comfortable but not flash. We ate in the restaurant located next to the hotel on two nights and the food was good and reasonable, even though it looks very posh and formal; we found it good value. Unfortunately, our trip was marred by a theft from my luggage of a wrapped bottle of duty free perfume. The hotel made no fuss about it at all, which seemed strange and I had to fill in an account of the theft and also visit the police station. These things happen. I was more upset by the fact that the hotel did not apologise or recompense me for the theft despite me doing everything I was told to do to get them to be able to claim on their insurance as I could not claim on mine. I have written countless emails, two letters and had promises it is being dealt with but a year later I have heard nothing. I know Italy is known for it's bureacracy but still...... Whilst the hotel cannot be blamed entirely for this and I was silly enough to leave this in my luggage, I did not expect my bags to be riffled through by hotel staff when I was not there. The after sales care was the thing that spoilt my trip. I would say use the hotel but use the safe for everything and don't expect great customer service, it did not happen for me.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: JJetson1
Reviews.Content: I know the "star" ratings are different in Europe from the U.S., but this was like a bad Motel 6. Even when we complained about the filth (see mold in showers, carpets not vacumed, etc) and where upgraded it was bad. The only redeeming feature of this hotel is that it is well-located.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: aescudero
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Cicerone hotel and if you are from the US you will notice the differences right away. For one, a double room usually means twin beds, and no two rooms are built to look the same. The room was just average for it being a four star hotel. The staff was slow to respond to issues too. Our safe didn't work and in Italy you must protect your money and your passport. They fixed it the last day we were there, even though we asked them to fix it the first night we arrived. We also had a room on the 8th floor but the elevator stops on the 7th! It was quiet though, so that was nice. You can't beat the location of the hotel though, as it is within walking distance (15 minutes) of the Vatican City. All in all, it was clean, not luxurious but decent. Beds were hard, towels stiff, flat, flat, flat pillows, but they had plenty of hot water and the toilet pressure was good. Oh, and whatever you do buy a blow dryer in Italy, if you need one. Their's worked like a vacuum cleaner nozzle set to low--resembled one too! The free buffet breakfast was good. Although American style scrambled eggs are so much better than Italian scrambled eggs (Yuck!).

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met our needs, but beyond that, it certainly was nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: elitha
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night to be near the Vatican....and found ourselves in a rather dismal room that was tired and equivalent of a tired Comfort Inn. It was clean and functional. The bed and pillows were hard, but we have found that to be the case in the two hotels that we stayed in Rome. There is nothing right around the hotel, but it is certainly not a bad walk to the Vatican, to Piazza Novanna/Pantheon...a very pleasant walk actually.. The breakfast food was plentiful but not appetizing at all...the orange juice was strange!! If you are looking for a serviceable place to stay, then it would be ok....but don't get your hopes up about staying somewhere nice...and with the price of the room, you would expect much nicer!! elitha 10/21/09

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Vatican but not a great property”
Reviews.Author: DonnaGZ
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, close to the Vatican and St Peter's but furniture and linens were quite worn and we had a view of a concrete wall.. It is pricey for the quality of the room. The breakfast choices were good. We stayed here for three days and then moved to the Dei Mellini for the last three days and liked that property much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad by American Standards”
Reviews.Author: Reese421
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decent. Location is OK, not too much around it, but not as bad as some desolate locations. Overall cleanliness and service of hotel is good. You must remember European hotels are not like American hotels, with the luxuries of a strong a/c and centered locations, but I did enjoy my stay. Just being in Italy makes it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Choose your room carefully!”
Reviews.Author: janfromtoledo
Reviews.Content: Met our family in Rome at this hotel. We had a total of four rooms. Three of the the rooms were very old (1970 style) and in desperate need of updating. Old, worn, frayed carpeting etc. One room however was on a floor that had been renovated. That room was new, bright and modern. It was not the room I stayed in. Breakfast was included and very good. The staff were very friendly. The location was close to the Vatican. If you like walking the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. were a bit further. The pictures are of Suite Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Close to main sights”
Reviews.Author: teatimeIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent location for walking to all main sights of interest. We found the staff helpful on all occasions except when we requested breakfast half an early before an early pick up for a city tour.The rooms and bathrooms were always comfortable and clean and we never had any problems with noise or the lifts while our rooms were on the seventh floor.We were happily satisfied with the wide choice of cereals,fruit juice, fresh fruit, bread, meats and the usual cooked varieties available for breakfast.I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Rome for a short stay without having to rely on any form of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so helpful”
Reviews.Author: lishwiener
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Ciccerone.My sister had stayed there and told us it was a little further out but we were there in summer and love walking and seeing different areas that you w ould not normally go to.The staff were brilliant. Helpful in all areas of hotel needs and maps and routes to take. couldn't have asked for better. I had originally asked for a quiet room not realising that August most things are closed and everything is quiet.Didn't really like the room so went and asked to be moved. No problem. New room and very happy. The aussi dollar is crappy so this was value for money. Breakfast more than adequate and covers off most of your needs. Transport just outside the door if you don't want to walk so I would say it is worth the stay.The staff even made restaurant reservations for us to check that the restaurants were open before we headed off. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: triptakerChicago
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to metro and in a very nice, quiet neighborhood. You can walk to various sites. The hotel staff was very helpful in every way. They anticipated our needs (giving us info that we hadn't even asked for yet) and helped with some personal phone calls by speaking Italian for us. Nice. It was hot and the room had great air conditioning (very cool). Breakfast was very nice. This hotel and another we experienced this summer can't seem to get the bread and rolls right but otherwise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beter than last time , yes most certainly”
Reviews.Author: geordietraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We were at Rome Cicerone for our Honeymoon last year , and returned because we liked it so much , the stay and treatment from the staff was absolutely excellent again , and we stayed for a full 14 nights . We made friends with Sandro and Raimondo on the Breakfasting staff and Marco the night porter last year , unfortunately Raimondo has now retired And Marco has now left , but Sandro is still there to advise and help with planned days out , he will tell you all the history of Rome and the most beatiful places to go and see that aren't on the tourist maps, he is also a part time Roman soldier with a historical group. One of Sandros recomendations is a day out at Austia Ancia this was the port of Rome and was a town of 100,000 people and was really some size and it is as good as pompei if not better , you will need to take a metro to get there but it is well worth it , and you will need a full day and good walking shoes , and take some water and sun block it gets hot , there is a open air theatre that is still in use today , when we were there there was a Shakespear week of plays on at night. There is also two nightime markets one at Castel Saint Angelo , this is in a lovely setting around the castel and has three stages for music , plays , and discusion groups, there are restaurants , bookstalls , gifts , clothes ect, the market is on till about 1.00 in the morning and is the place to go at night , then the other is down the river tiber about 1 or 2 kilometers from the castel , and is at Ponte Sisto just beside the Trastervere area , this market is even bigger and has very large bars ,food stalls , ect but there is also a open air cinema for about 200 seated , this is on the island in the tiber , if the market bores you , you could spend the night in the Trastevere areas many shops restaurants and bars in this quaint cobbled steet area that is regarded by many Romans as the true centre of Rome , and I can recomend the street artists and artistic photographers work. We even took a trip out with Sandro to a place near the Popes summer home ,( Castel Gandolfo ) the village was called Niemi and it is stunning its perched up on the rocky slopes of the moutain , and the local delicecy is crepes with nutella and wild strawberries they are to die for , the lake below is beautiful and serene . there was loads more fun , ie. Springsteen at the stadio olimpico. Everything was fabulous , apart from our arrival when we had a taxi con almost worked on us , last time to our hotel it was about 15 euro to the cicerone from termini train station , we had a driver of a white cab ask us if we wanted a taxi , they are the legitemate one you should always use , but he then said to his partner to take us, so he took us over the road and away from the taxi rank down a side street , so was concerned and asked him in the bit Italian that I know How much his reply was40 euro after I told him no he dropped the price to 30 euros , I told him no again so he dumped our cases and walked away swearing . So please try to check the farest and don't go away from the ranks. Oh and use the buses from the airports to the city as they are much cheaper and you can book your return as well . Rome is a must for all , and the Cicerone is perfectly placed for it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: Triangletravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cicerone looks lovely on the website but is more mundane in person. The rooms were adequate and its' close to the sights. However, we found the cleanliness and maintanence to be laxing. The elevators often weren't working which is hard after a long hot day walking and having a room on the 6th floor. However, it was the rudeness of the staff that made it worse. We found them to be perfunctory at best. We would recommend if you get a great deal and don't expect much. However, we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cicerone - Excellent location but some faults”
Reviews.Author: Montgomr
Reviews.Content: While the location of the Cicerone is excellent, in particular for those with a special interest in St Peter's and the Vatican, and while rooms are adequate, we (my wife, adult son and I) were disappointed by a number of things. The hotel seems to be aimed mostly at large groups, and is overall in need of some freshening up. The busy staff at reception were reasonably efficient but not very friendly or welcoming. The television in our room was malfunctioning, and an extinguished lighbulb in my bedside lamp was not replaced over the three days of our stay. The toilet seat in our ensuite was cracked, and there was dirt around the airconditioning unit. A slightly musty cigarette aroma lingered. Worst was the appalling breakfast: bread and cakes were stale, fruit was tinned, eggs and milk watery. We would also recommend against the Grotta Azzurra restaurant across the road: the food is cheap but the service uncharacteristically poor (we were brought the wrong dishes in the wrong order).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: Alegna11
Reviews.Content: The Cicerone Hotel far exceeded any expectations I had! It's centrally located to most attractions: I was within walking distance of St. Peter's, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Campo d'Fiori, the Pantheon, Piazza del Popolo, and the list goes on and on. It's also surrounded by some excellent places to eat. (There are lots of little cafes and restaurants on the surrounding side streets frequented by locals with great food and reasonable prices!) The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was roomy and nicely appointed. It was immaculately clean and the bathroom was heavenly! (Huge tub to soak in at the end of a long day!) Breakfast was the usual buffet fare with helpful waitstaff to assist. The only tiny negative is the the bed was extremely firm, but it was such a minute negative that it's barely worth mentioning. Overall my stay at the Cicerone Hotel was a very pleasant one. I will absolutely stay there again when I next visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities”
Reviews.Author: noipop3
Reviews.Content: It was the first 3 nights me and my wife stayed to this hotel in our 2-week travel in Italy. This 4 star hotel provided us with calm nights which were really good for us. It was not very expensive comparing to other 4 star hotels as the location is not in the right centre of the city. But the nearest metro station is 5min from the hotel. So the location was not really the problem. The best thing of this hotel for us was the amenities. The slippers were especially great. We took them and used them for the rest of the travel. There were not so many choices for dinner around the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: niki16
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean rooms. Good customer service. Bar was convenient but pricey. The cafe down the street and across the way was a better value with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Traveler First Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MissDiss
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, Concerige, room service, Maid Service was very good My room was great. (718) I was in front of the hotel, and when I was on my balony I could see the Justice Building. Walking distance to the Vatican, well known by taxi drivers, resturants around every corner. Bank acros the street. Being from the states I'm use to having an ice machine on the floor of your room. After a long day of walking I came back to my room got into my comfortable clothes and wanted some ice. Not knowing I had to go downstairs to retrive a bucket of ice. Had to get dress in appropiate attire to get ice. Great that there are resturants close by but a noisy bunch does pass by in the evening, not best when you're trying to fall asleep. All in all it was a great hotel, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie082
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel on the North Side of the river, about 10 minutes walk from Vatican City We paid 310€ for 3 nights (for 2 people) incl breakfast and we couldnt really fault the value. Hotel was lively with Amercian Tourists getting of the buses day and night. Rome City is 20 minutes walk across the river, and Ancient Rome is a pleasant 35 minutes walk. A good location for all of Rome. Number 70 bus takes you from outside the hotel to the train station, (1€) and a train takes you the Leonardo Da Vinci airport in 25 mins (11€). However when we landed we opted to get a shuttle to the airport , this can end up touring the city before dropping you off, but we were lucky and were first (18€ each) taxis were quoting 50 - 75€ Breakfasts were typcial continental but good. Hard for me to find any faults

Reviews.Title: “Keep Away”
Reviews.Author: alik06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone Hotel 2 nights and the hotel has a very good location. Our stayed was very pleasant until last night, when I realized that somebody had stolen me a pair of shoes. Is insignificant the pair of shoes, but what it is important was the attitude that took the hotel staff . Nobody worried about the matter and only they were capable to tell me was "we are so sorry".

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sweetie26
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our stay. We stayed here 5 years ago and we returned. Great location to all sights close to Piazza Cavour and Piazza Navona. Helpful and Friendly Staff. Clean and neat rooms.....glad they are updating the decor. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We're going back--for a third stay”
Reviews.Author: ilpadre42
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome and stayed here in June of 2007, again in December of the same year. We loved this place. The staff was personable and helpful. One of the reasons we are going back to Rome is to see these people.

Reviews.Title: “A rather utilitarian establishment in Rome's Prati district”
Reviews.Author: MortimerOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: The Cicerone is in Prati, an area Romans do there shoppin in. It is also near to the Vatican and one can easily walk to the historic centre in 15-20 minutes. It does not rate highly on charm, having a 1980s look to it. Our rooms were baking hot and, despite repeated requests to reception staff, it was impossible to have the heating switched off. It seems that Roman hotels, like Roman apartment buildings, have set dates for switching heating on and off. Opening the French windows to the terrace was only an option when one was not in the room as every bus in the city seems to roar its way along Via Cicerone. Note: colleages with rooms not on the street side could open windows without having problems of noise. Breakfast was uninteresting. The hotel seems to be popular with Japanese package tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service top notch!!”
Reviews.Author: LovinVegas33
Reviews.Content: My husband and my parents stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and our expectations were blown away. The rooms were quite large (queen bed with desk, pull-out couch and enormous bathroom). I believe that if you stay on the 7th floor you will most likely get a balcony which was a real treat! We slept with the patio doors open every night! The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful especially when it came to ensuring we got on our buses for tours and our flights back home. The breakfast was great which offered a variety of meats, yogurts, cheeses, cereal, fresh fruit, juices and more! The location was a highlight as the area was great for shopping, dining and wasn't as congested as across the bridge where several organized school trips must of been staying. Whether you're there for 2 nights or 7 nights, I highly recommend this hotel as you will get your barrings quickly and enjoy the location. We even found a restaurant we went back to several times during our stay called San Marco which was a 3 mins walk from the hotel. Food and service was amazing. The restaurant across the street from the hotel was also very impressive. Too bad we waited until the end of the trip to eat there! There is also a quaint little deli/store down the road where we bought meats and cheeses and wine and water to have for mid-day snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Bagrov
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in an excellent location - close to everything, but away from hordes of tourists. Nice restaurants in the area. Breakfast could have been better - you might have expected a bit more variety so at the end of day 3 it gets really boring, but quality of food is good and service is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DesTh
Reviews.Content: I was last October in Rome with a group. The hotel was booked by a travel agent. The rooms were smelling badly and had nothing to do with the fotos on the site. They told us that the hotel is under renovation ... until then i would recommend it only as a cheap stay close to the Vatican and the monuments of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JouniH
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome! We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Cicerone with my wife. I was a bit worried before our trip, after reading so many negative comments about Cicerone. Fortunately we founded those comments false. Room was old, but clean. Unfortunately pillows are flat and hard, but we managed to sleep well enough. Breakfast was nice, but bacon lacks salt. Staff is as friendly as everyone in Rome, if you know what I mean. Location is very good. Traffic is not too loud eventhough there is only single glass windows. Compared to Finnish hotels Cicerone is rather 3 stars than 4, but still ok place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalNd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Cicerone as part of our pre-cruise package. Basic accomodations, clean room, great location for the Vatican and walking distance to most sites. The room was quite small (not unusual for Europe) and did not look like the rooms on the website, but it was very adequate. Bed was the hardest we've ever encountered. Did not utilize the bar or restaurant. Our room was very quiet because it was located overlooking the courtyard so no traffic noise. Would stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: 2burkes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a group tour and we loved it! The hotel is in a fantastic location. We walked to many of Rome's sights, including the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain. There are a few great places to eat very close to the hotel. There is also a grocery store close by for buying cheap bottled water and snacks before heading out for a day of sightseeing. The hotel itself is clean and the staff is friendly. Our room was more than adequate for the two of us. There was a nice selection at breakfast and plenty to go around. When we return to Rome, we look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: dmnorthcutt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to everything you need to get to. The lobby of the hotel is nice and they give great advise on restaurants near by. The only down fall that I saw within the hotel is the size of the rooms. We stayed on the top floor of the hotel which does not have an elevator to get to. So if you are carrying alot of lugagge be prepared to tote it up the stairs. The rooms that we stayed in didnt have a/c but you can crack the window and a nice breeze will cool things off.The breakfast is okay, but overall the stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “great location...”
Reviews.Author: momoriarty
Reviews.Content: The Ciccerone was a wonderful hotel to stay. The location is great. When we checked in I asked the clerk if he had a nice room for me. He then took out his sheet, switched some numbers around and gave us a great room. Our original room was small and on the street side of the hotel, which I would think could be loud. We ended up with an inside room, which was larger than most and had a balcony. There was not a great view, but you could at least walk out and get some air. We also had a day bed in the room. The room was very clean. Across the street is a restaurant... The Grotto Azurra. We had a great meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry, It's a Fine Place”
Reviews.Author: love2travelMN
Reviews.Content: Before we traveled we saw many negative comments on this hotel, but I would like to report that we had a very good experience. It was the same and in some cases much nicer than some hotels in the US. The front desk staff was accommodating, the rooms and bathrooms large enough, and the breakfast very satisfactory. The central location is excellent. The twin beds and no washcloths are common in Europe, I understand. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and old”
Reviews.Author: Srniortraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Cicerone while on a Perillo tour. It was a very dark, tierd hotel. Very, very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would go there again”
Reviews.Author: Ellemic
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about this hotel at all. The location was great. Walking distance to Castel Sant'Angelo and half hour to The Vatican. It might sound long but with views you get in Rome, I didn't complain. The nearest train station to the hotel is Lepanto which is also around a 5 minute walk. The area also has a few restaurants and of course gelati shops. The staff at the hotel were courteous and friendly. The hotel has a nice foyer and on the left hand side there is a bar. The bedrooms were spacious. Could hardly fault it really. A reasonable sized bathroom and was clean. The beds were comfortable and clean, television had English speaking channels. The breakfast was pretty good as well. A variety of food including cereal, croissants, fruit, yoghurt etc. I really cannot say anything bad about it because there was nothing to complain about. If I was going back to Rome I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cicerone - ummmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Sarz5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone last week for 5 nights. I only booked it because it had been reduced from 1400 euros to 500 euros for that 5 nights so to be honest I was expecting something quite special and even though I had read the reviews, thought well for 1400 euros for 5 nights it must be quite good. Its near the metro, about a five minute walk away. There are loads of buses from outside the hotel which take you into the centre - so transport is not a problem, too be honest its walkable too, we usually walked home at the end of the day. There are some nice restaurants around the hotel if the thought of going back into the centre is just too tiring after a days sightseeing and a lovely cocktail/ice cream bar around the corner. We didnt try the hotel's restaurant at all expect for our breakfast which was included in the price. The breakfast was ok. Thats all I can say about it. I had scrambled egg and bread and honey every morning. My husband tried the bacon and sausages but didnt find them very nice. The first morning his coffee was fine, but the rest of the week it looked like a mud mixed with water and he said it tasted like it, it must have been made for so long before coming out to the table. Although I must say my tea was fine! They had a selection of cereal, youguts, cold meat and cheese as well, so I'm sure you could find something you liked. Also a small collection of cakes and bread. The room was pleasant, we were overlooking the courtyard so didnt suffer from the noise from the road, so cant comment on that. The bed was very comfortable, better than the mattress I have at home, I was very impressed with it. The only thing that let the room down was the shower, it was hot enough etc, but had no proper shower curtain so the floor got all wet and the shower tray overfilled. But we could live with that. I certainly found the room clean and the room was made every day with new towels, and the towels were full sized bath towels not the small ones you usually have to contend with which was lovely. I suppose my biggest beef, being a smoker - what with the smoking laws in Italy - that there was nowhere to go for a ciggy. No balcony, no couryard etc. I had to stand on the street out side the hotel, so this was why we didnt have a drink or eat there as there are so many places with seating outside that you can. Final conclusion is, if I had paid 1400 euros for the 5 nights I would have been very very disapointed and feel sorry for anyone that did. For 500 euros it was a comfortable, convenient, clean hotel. All I would say is that if you are a smoker it may be better to try and find somewhere with a terrace or balcony.

Reviews.Title: “So So Experience”
Reviews.Author: SherlockTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location to visit the Vatican and we also walked across the river to see a lot of the major sights i.e. Spanish Steps, Piazza Navone, Pantheon. I would argue that it is definitely not up to the standard of a 4 star hotel, more like a 3 star at most. It has a rather dated 70's feel to it and the view from the balcony in our room was rather unpleasant/dire to say the least - we kept the curtains firmly drawn to block out the bleak, scruffy internal courtyard/fire escape. The room was very spacious, but could have done with a spruce up & lick of paint as the walls were a bit marked/grimy & there was a distinct lack of hangers. You need to be at least 5ft 6inches tall to reach the hanger rail in the wardrobe, I managed this fine but anyone smaller would have had to get a chair and climb up. There was also a pull down sofa unfortunately with a with a rather tatty cover. The highlight of our stay came when the fire alarms went off at approx 11.30 pm when we were snoozing in bed after a marathon days sightseeing - we threw some clothes on, grabbed our purse/wallet and legged it out of the room, down a metal fire escape to the grimy courtyard where I pulled open a metal gate to access the main street. We walked back into the hotel through the main entrance to find a few other sensible bods had responded to the fire alarm & were in their PJ's at reception or looking half asleep sitting close by. It was like a scene from Titanic as the 'turn' kept singing in the bar area & other guests laughed & carried on drinking - False alarm just the electrician set it off! I overheard an American guy at reception saying that this had also happened a few times earlier in the day and he wanted to complain to the manager. All said, the fire escape worked well, although my hands were black from the gate I'd opened and my face/clothes looked like i'd been down a coal mine were I'd touched them. Take your own corkscrew if you plan on opening a bottle of wine etc, they will insist on bringing one to your room & charging you 3 euros for the pleasure of the housekeeping bod opening your bottle. Also if you need anything ironing, bring your own travel iron - they won't lend you an iron/board and the prices are pretty steep for the hotel laundry to iron your clothes if required. The breakfast is mediocre & I gave the runny scrambled eggs & hot dog sausages a wide berth, although the coffee was quite nice. The reception staff were pleasant enough- especially a young guy who we found to be very helpful and informative. A hotel car/mercedes back to ciampino airport cost a fixed price of 50 euros. To sum up, we had a pleasant enough stay - room/hotel we expected a little bit more of and it was not of a 4 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: newbie_traveler3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a Globus Tour of Italy. Hotel was very nice. Within walking distance to many restaurants and stores. Grocery store not too far away was great to stock up on water and beer for the hotel room. Room was clean and bathroom was fairly large for European standards. Breakfast buffet at hotel restaurant was included was decent. One of the better on the tour. Would recommend. You are not right next to any of the main attractions (Vattican Coliseum, etc.), but if you don't mind walking there's plenty to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaserSailor47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights while exploring Rome. The room was a little small; however, it was quite clean. The staff was about average for any hotel. What I liked best was the location. The subway was only two blocks away. If you don't mind walking (I don't) many of the attractions are fairly close. My wife and I felt safe in the neighborhood. Hadrians mausoleum (Castel Sant'Angelo) is close as is The Vatican. When I say close, I mean within about twenty to thirty minutes walking distance. As I said, I enjoy walking, especially in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone Hotel a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Matthew55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a pre-cruise stay in Rome at the Cicerone Hotel. We were pleased at the accommodations, service and location of this hotel. One word of advise, the hotel does not provide wash clothes, as do many hotels in Europe so bring your own if you wish to have one for bathing. The hotel was booked independently from the cruise. We discovered that our cruise line and the tour companies, Globus and Trafalgar also use the hotel for their clients when in Rome. Our room was clean and large enough for the 3 of us. The air conditioning worked very well, helping us to beat the hot Rome summer temperatures. The hotel's location is about a 15-20 walk to Vatican City. There are plenty of stores for shopping plus cafes and restaurants nearby or a short walk from the hotel. ATM's are readily available on the streets. We booked Travel Bound for our transfers from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the ship at the end of our stay in Rome. Travel Bound was reliable, prompt, courteous and less cost than the cruise line transfers that were offered. This hotel is a good choice for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel via private taxi which I had booked on the internet. The taxi driver could not speak any english but the staff at the hotel were very helpful in translating for us. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was comfortable and our room was very spacious and well planned out. We had our first evening meal in the hotel. The menu was limited but the main course steak was excellent although a few vegetables would not have gone amiss. The dessert was excellent. However the breakfast was very poor. Not even toast. As it was advertised as an "American Breakfast" we did expect something better. We found the hotel to be in a very good location within easy walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryntessa
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights this week with my teenaged daughter. The room was OK - small, not fancy. Didn't feel like a 4 star hotel. Breakfast was mediocre at best. Staff was rude and unfriendly, not attentive to our needs, would not supply an adaptor, did not send promised technician to repair hair dryer. But the location was good - easy walk to the Vatican, shopping, good restaurants and gelato. Good Chinese food around the corner. Rome is HOT in the summer!! After being in London and Paris, we were happy with the cheaper prices in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: After the rain and cold temperatures of Dublin proved to be too much for our summer vacation, we decided to take a short trip to Rome and booked the Cicerone last minute for an excellent price. The Cicerone is a perfectly adequate hotel for a short stay. As this was my fourth time in Rome, I can say with some authority that the Cicerone is well-situated in a safe area - within walking distance of many Rome attractions, including the Vatican. We did, however, take taxis over to the area where the Colosseum, etc. are located due to heat and time considerations. The rooms are clean but not particularly contemporary in terms of decor - in fact, the entire feel of the hotel is as if you are in 1970's Rome not 2008's Rome. The rooms are fairly large for a European hotel, though, and there were plenty of towels, etc. My partner noted that the breakfast was not spectacular. if you are looking for a well-located, reasonably-priced hotel for a short stay in Rome, the Cicerone is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around, I still liked it”
Reviews.Author: female_wanderer
Reviews.Content: We went on a Globus/Monograms tour and they booked us in this hotel. This is the second time I've stayed in it and I still liked it. The location for us was excellent - within walking distance of all the major sites. Three blocks from a Metro station. Lots of great restaurants, both cheap and expensive, within short range along with cheap grocery stores and great gelato. The rooms themselves, though a bit small (but standard for Europe) were very nice. They have remodeled since our last visit two years ago and I thought nicely updated. We really liked our visit here, same as before. The breakfast was very good too, with very good staff that were right on top of everything. If the staff is not overly friendly, that is Italy - Italians don't go overboard to be friendly and polite, but this hotel, especially for Italy, was very responsive to any problems or questions we had. I would definitely go back. Very nice for Americans travelling too as all staff speak English.

Reviews.Title: “No complain”
Reviews.Author: Mtl-travelers
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel that was part of the tour we booked with Globus. Location is ideal. We stayed for 3 nights. The 1st night, we were given a room on the 1st floor. It was a small room and quite noisy due to the noise from the street, had a bad night sleep. The next day, we asked them to switch room and this was done immediately, hassle free. The new room was on the 2nd floor and overlooking the inside courtyard. Nice & quiet. Both rooms were clean and very good for european standard. Staff were friendly and informative. For those that complain and expect the same standard as hotels in America..Don't ! You are not in America!! So have an open mind and adjust.

Reviews.Title: “The Cicerone was great”
Reviews.Author: thedorp
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Rome and we didn't know what to expect from a hotel there. The Cicerone was excellent--clean and modern. We had a comfortable room with a king sized bed and a nice sized and very clean bathroom. The hotel price included a full "all you can eat" buffet breakfast with American-style coffee!!!! Best of all is the hotel's location. It is within easy walking distance to the Vatican and the great shops and restaurants by the Spanish Steps. We also walked to the Colliseum and other City sites. We highly recommend the Cicerone if you are traveling to Rome. Don't forget to try the cappocinos!

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone has some flaws”
Reviews.Author: reniev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and the lobby looks exactly like the photo on this web. But the rooms in the photo appear large and they are not. They are small. The air conditioning was shut off at 9 p.m. one of the two nights there and not turned back on til 9 a.m. the next morning. That day the temperatures reached 87 degrees and to say that the room was stuffy is an understatement. The staff could be very friendly or arrogant. Ice Machine was broken for a period of time as well and when I went to the bar to beg for some ice I was told that if he gave me ice, then he couldn't work, so NO. There is no courtyard or rooftop area to relax in when you are not touring or running around. I would not return to this hotel. For the price that we paid, Cicerone did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: ChoppoCapitola
Reviews.Content: The hotel does a great 'bait and switch' with the rooms; you pay an extraordinary price and get the most ordinary room! We paid about $400 a night, which is the advertised rate for a suite, and got a noisy, second floor room facing the street with two twin beds! The man at the desk, Guiseppe, was arrogant, rude, and dogmatic about the room, the noise, everything....nothing was done about the problem. Would not stay here again on a bet. Don't be fooled...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SandyShoreIllinois
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 nights at this hotel. 3rd time we stayed here. We love the location and the hotel. Never had a bad room--always clean, roomy and quiet. We request an inside-facing room. Many reviews indicate the front desk staff is rude. I don't agree with that -- my opinion, just "Italian-style" -- not American-style phony. They are all characters. Ask the "cashier" for change? Ha - no change available. Each person has his/her own job, so you can go from one to another. I found this more fun and Italian-style charming. Go with the flow... you are in ROME not Indianapolis! Hotel DOES have alot of tours coming and going, but we were on our own and were not around when they came and went, so they did not bother us. This is a medium size hotel, not a mega resort. There is a small bar/lounge area off the lobby. They try an American-style breakfast with scrambled eggs and bacon...pretty good. Also European-style cheeses and luncheon meats as well as breads, yogurt, cereal, fruit, juices and cappuccino. You can't go away hungry unless you want to. Two good trattorias I would recommend. One just across the street, Grotta Azzurra, has great steaks, pasta and THE BEST Pizza Margherita...try it. Around the corner is our favorite, al Palazzaccio. Great Roman lamb, veal & ravioli with walnut cream sauce. Wine great, also. Waiters - very entertaining - Marcianno speaks some English, loves women and is actually shy. We had the best time staying here and would recommend it to anyone who is open to real Roman people.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Moltovino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone on May 16th and 17th. The room was good size though there were 3 of us so we had a larger room possibly than a couple or single would. It was pretty clean and the bar and bartender (Marco I think) was great! The staff are pretty unfriendly but we didn't have to deal with them too much. We were on a tour (which I saw someone else complain about) so yes there were allot of people there and breakfast though decent was a bit of a nightmare in the morning. It was in a great location with lots of places to eat and walking distance to lots of places like the piaza del popolo etc. Bathroom was ok. Don't expect much from the hair dryer. Included a pic. A little dark sorry. Overall not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone is a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: KHoodMo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Cicerone and found it to be a fine hotel. Not amazing but it worked for us. It was in a good location, lots of shops and cafes are very close. The staff at the desk are a bit unfriendly but it seems they are running all the operations from behind the desk. Just make sure you deal with the concierge, not the managers. A great meal tip is try San Marco a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A truly horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lkmkpt
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I stayed in during my 10 days in Italy. In fact, I would say it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff was unpleasant and unhelpful. The room was truly disgusting. I rolled the bedspread and comforter onto the floor to ensure that neither touched me. The drapes had obviously not been cleaned in the last year. Huge, gray dirt marks showed all along the bottom of the drapes. The carpet was gross. Black mold was all over the vent in my room. The entire room was filthy. Please do not make the mistake of staying here. Hideous!

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself A Favor And Avoid This Nasty Dirty Place”
Reviews.Author: iloveItalyUsa
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are small, filthy and had black mold on the vents. I never took my shoes off because the carpet was so nasty. The pictures of the hotel look fantastic but I can promise you they are not accurate. The breakfast is horrible and the staff are very unfriendly and never made eye contact. The room was stuffy and had a bad odor and the air conditioner wasn't working. The only positives I can come up with is, 1) the coffee at breakfast was good, 2) the location was good. 3) the shower was good. Hardly worth it though, I would have rather stayed outside on the sidewalk, it was cleaner than the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: denisepg
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a much better rating all around even though our in room internet was not working, they said we could use the internet downstairs for approx 4 x's the price we did without it it was no big deal. I called the desk to find out the rate to make a local call I was told .20 cent euro for 2-3 min. we made 2 local phone calls that went through each for approx. 3-5 minutes. Upon check out I was told my phone charges were over 12 euro. They said I made 3 calls and one call was over 11 euro. When I tried to explain that I made only 2 calls and then asked what number was called they could not tell me. To avoid any problems I paid and figured I'd contact the hotel directly when I got home. No one has replied to my emails. I am going to write a letter directly. I feel that there is some mistake and that maybe someone came in my room and made a phone call. I would like them to look into this matter.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive treat!”
Reviews.Author: Interrailed2007
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel in a safe location, close to the Vatican, although we found the staff slightly snobby and the food wasn't great. We had a large, air conditioned room with a really spacious bathroom, although the hairdryer was broken. The hotel runs lots of day excursions around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeisegirlWaterford
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome stayed in the Cicerone I can't say enough about this hotel or it's staff.Was a bit apprehensive before I went after reading some of the reviews,but what a pleasant surprise,the room was spotlessly clean,and it was cleaned everyday with a change of both towels and linen daily.We had a room at the front and we were not kept awake any night also it was warm and comfortable and we had plenty of natural light through the large window.The staff could not be more helpful or pleasant.Will definitely stay there again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: alanpk
Reviews.Content: Was slightly worried having read so many differing reviews of this place but happy to say that it was a pleasant surprise for the price we paid. We had what is supposedly a dreaded front room but thanks to new double glazing and a refurb this was fine- we didn't hear a bit of noise and the bed was even quite comfortable Breakfast was ok (for an Italian one) and the concierge was happy to store our bags once we'd checked out so we could explore Rome without carrying everything around Only slight downside was the room got very warm and the heating can;lt be switched to cool (no air con). But it had been blasting out all day so had we switched it down sooner it would have probably been ok- just beware for summer though All in all great for the price

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: tasydney
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with this hotel. The heater in the room didn't work and despite 3 calls to reception with promises someone was on the way to look at it no one ever turned up. Likewise we asked for extra blankets because the room was cold twice and never saw them. This hotel is one of the noisiest hotels I have ever stayed in. there is no soundproofing on the doors and every one has to slam the doors to close them - it was like fireworks for hours on end every night with all the banging. Also there were noisy kids running up and down the halls and in the next room - I had to buy ear plugs to sleep at night. Despite 2 requests for a quieter room, I was told they were fully booked and it was not possible to change rooms. Be warned - stay well away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: schickchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Cicerone from November 23rd to the 28th. We found it to be better than we thought it would be. The breakfasts were plentiful, great scrambled eggs, pastries, cold cuts, etc. Yes, the rooms were a littled dated but still very functional. It was a quiet hotel (but please ask for a room not along the front of the hotel). We didn't hear people walking and talking in the hallways once. It was a good and safe location. The showers were nice and hot.. The staff worked very hard every morning to get the buffet organized and serve coffee and tea to everyone in a short amount of time. It is a great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: inconspicuous
Reviews.Content: The best thing was the breakfast. But the scrambled eggs were cold, and some of the bread was stale. There was a good selection though. The carpets and bedspreads lookeddirty and were stained. Light was very dim I needed a flashlight just to see the colors of my clothes in the suitcase. One day we decided to go down a little early for breakfast. The line went outside the dining room, down a corridor, into the lobby and ended at the reception desk. We decided to go back upstairs and wait upstairs. We were part of a Globus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and Charming”
Reviews.Author: tizzlizz
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip overseas and being a very particular person, I was quite concerned that the European hotels would not be comfortable. I was VERY happily surprised by the Cicerone! The room was larger than expected, though it did have twin-sized beds. I was actually quite comfortable and they provided me with the number of pillows that I requested immediately. The closet was exceedingly small, but they gave me tons of extra clothes hangers and there was a cul-de-sac in the wall that we used for folded garments and even our suitcases. All in all, more than enough space to be comfortable. The bathroom was larger than those in most American hotels and was very clean. Lots of counter space and we had no trouble storing our toiletries. We didn't eat at the restaurant as there are SO many fantastic options within TRUE walking distance. But we did have a pre-dinner drink every night at the bar. Gianni (spelling?) is the BEST bartender I've ever seen. Funny, professional and informative. He had me hooked on an Italian apertif called Martini Bianco. Try it on ice! Your room key is on a huge brass ball and you drop it off at the front desk as you leave each day. The funny thing, is that anyone can ask for any room key and RECEIVE it! I did this deliberately just to see what would happen. Oh well, the in-room safe worked and I never, ever felt uncomfortable. I've read a lot of poor reviews about the breakfast buffet and I can't say the food was the best but there was never a line and we enjoyed the juice, melba toast and other pastries. I'd highly recommend just walking into a local bar for a coffee and pastry instead. Very inexpensive. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and that's very high praise coming from me!

Reviews.Title: “Large, tourist coach hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone Hotel for 5 nights in September 2007 as part of a Globus tour. The room was large (by European standards) and quiet. The linen was changed every day and was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was very clean but old and ‘tired’ – it needed to be renovated. The breakfast room provided a buffet breakfast but the bread was stale, no rolls (only croissants), lids left off the hot food, and often the tablecloths were stained (from earlier diners and they hadn’t been changed). Because this appears to be a hotel for lots of coach tours, it was crowded and the breakfast staff were not very friendly (maybe they were getting to the end of a long summer?). One morning we were up for a 6:30am breakfast because the coach tour for the Vatican Museum left at 7am. The queue for the breakfast room was very long and when we got in, the room was crowded, some of the serving dishes had not been replenished and it was a scramble for what was there. This was meant to be a 4 star hotel but the breakfast was about 2 star. The reception staff were knowledgeable but again appeared to be lacking any genuine friendliness toward the customers. There was a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel but they were quite expensive. Location was good with lots of restaurants nearby and a 15 minute walk to the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: travlrover55
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Cicerone pre-cruise (Carnival) from Civitavecchia. This was our second visit to Rome, and I found the Cicerone superior to all other hotels I've stayed at in Italy. Location is terrific - walkable to Vatican City, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and great shopping just a few blocks away. Bedroom adequate & we got our requested king-size bed, large bathroom and shower, all clean & neat. Renovations still going on based on appearance of hallway on our floor, but I guess we got lucky--no construction noise. Front desk staff could be friendlier but no complaints with breakfast room or bar staff. Buy a drink at the bar and afternoon/early evening snacks are provided - including their *wonderful* marinated olives. Adequate selection & quality in breakfast room. "Security issues" noted by other travelers re door-knob with room key attached I've found is still pretty routine in Europe. With number of people coming & going at the front desk though, I got the feeling anyone could walk up and ask for any key in a box and get it. Regardless, I would definitely use this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Ship Central”
Reviews.Author: alexischristine
Reviews.Content: A group of us, 9 in total, were booked into this hotel by our cruiseline for one night before our cruise. We weren't alone. Not only our cruiseline, but a few others, use this hotel, all at the same time. The staff couldn't care less about us. Everything was left up to the cruiseline staff stationed at tables in the lobby. When we mentioned some water would be nice while waiting for our tours, we were told there are plenty of bars in Rome where we could get water. That is an example of the attitude of the front desk staff. While sitting at a closed bar located in the lobby, an alarm kept going off. It was there to make sure we wouldn't sneak a drink. Then we were told by a staff person that we could not sit on the stools and had to move. The rooms were small but very clean, with nice bathrooms. But the beds had the flattest pillows I have ever seen. Breakfast was fine with scrambled eggs, bacon, assorted fruit, cereals, juices, etc. The hotel is in a convenient area, close to the Vatican. A good restaurant is around the corner where we had a wonderful dinner that night. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic hotel in Rome, this one is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 bked through globus/monogram so it was an all inclusive packge on what rated as high superior . The facility was extremely clean and cared for daily. The bedrms were small but the beds were somewhat soft enough, the amenities in the bthrm was sufficient. The breakfast although on the expensive side was worth it specially if on the move the whole day and the next real meal is early afternoon. There is a wonderful lobby with a bar on one end and a talented piano player (on a grand piano) that couples enjoy, relax at the end of the day and get to do a little dancing. The vatican is a short 7 minutes away passing through the just building and the angel bridge. Beware though passing through the small plaza when alone at night. It is not well lighted and that plaza seems to be a gathering place for odd groups.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: cbevz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location between The Vatican & Piazza Navona! Very clean, Great AC! Defies rule of thumb to deduct a star from hotel expectations in Italy: Cicerone should be 4 stars! Breakfast average & busy, but sufficient,and coffee served however you like it. Cicerone staff were helpful,friendly, & efficient. Great hotel and great value for money. Would definitely stay there again if in Rome! A few reviews complain about hard wood floors in the rooms. I was absolutely thrilled - the floor is well-maintained and much more easily cleaned than carpetting = hygenic improvement. It, also, makes it feel a bit cooler during the summer heatwaves. Restaurants within walking distance. Checked-in hungry at 11:30 p.m., concierge phoned Ambasciatore di Capri restaurant around the corner to stay open to feed us. Sneered at the tourist menu, but the food was fresh & delicious, decent wine, and not over priced. More eateries on Via Cola di Rienzo, & on side streets toward Piazza Cavour. Tip: October 2006, Rome passed a fixed fee ordinance for airport taxis into the city [Ciampino 30 euros,FCO 40]. But there’s no enforcement! Taxis want double that to pay for their return to the airport. Airport bus to Termini (train station) 6 euros, than taxi 15 euros to Cicerone. Inquire if the hotel arranged taxi pick-up if it would be cheaper. If not, and you’re arriving late, with small children or have mobility issues, best bet is to pay the doubled taxi rate.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginnm
Reviews.Content: When you make a hotel reservation in a city you've never visited, you are never sure what you will end up with. Well, we were greeted warmly by the front desk, they were very helpful with directions to restaurants and sites. The hotel was quite busy with tour groups, and the front desk seemed to be helpful to everyone I saw in the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable. Not too big, but most are not in Rome. The breakfast was a very large buffet with a lot of variety in food. Location is only 10 blocks from the Vatican, which was why I chose this one over some others. We were not disappointed. We were even allowed to leave our bags there after checkout until after our tour of the Vatican. I would recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than the Cicerone”
Reviews.Author: Taz81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cicerone for five nights in August while on our honeymoon to Italy. I anticipated a true four star hotel due to the positive reviews I read prior to booking this hotel. However, we discovered that this hotel was more like a 2 1/2 star. Here is my quick list of pros and cons: Pros: great central location, walking distance to the Metro, the Vatican, and fun night spots such Campo de Fiori. Cons: Rude staff, charge you for double occupancy (in my case 30 euros additional per day) even after you have paid for the hotel via yoru travel provider (in my case orbitz), rooms are extremely tiny even for European standards, rooms feel stale and their bedding feels filthy, and to top it off they don't even give you an iron - instead they charge you 5 euros to iron a single shirt

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: kkrayman
Reviews.Content: After seeing pictures of the Ciccerone, I was very surprised at how small the rooms were. Actually, the room we had was just a little bigger than a ships stateroom. At the price we paid, it just was NOT worth it. Just a little info too, if you are bringing anything that needs to be charged, bring an international outlet, cause the hotel does not have any to sell or to lend to travelers. Also, they do NOT provide washcloths, the reasoning given to us was that italian wash with their hands, not washcloths. Go figga. I think the worse part of staying at that hotel was the front desk staff. VERY rude and abrupt. For a hotel that caters to international travelers and who "supposedly" was a 4 star hotel, it was a very big disappointment. On the positive note, the hotel was in a safer area of rome, rooms were clean and the bellmen were very helpful and friendly. Maybe they should give lessons to the front desk staff. By the way, there were around 20 people in our group and they all said the same thing about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, would go back”
Reviews.Author: MauiWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Cicerone 5 days before our cruise of the Med was to depart. The location is very good; close to the Vatican and other sights. Marcello at the front desk helped us arrange private tours of Tuscany, and recommended restaurants. Very nice guy. The hotel is old, but seemed very clean. No key card system for your room. You get a brass key attached to a heavy brass keychain, which you must leave with the front desk when exiting the hotel. The room was small, but I thought of it only as a place to crash for the night. The bathroom was clean. We had daily breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. The food was good. Nice mix of fruits, and the normal breakfast items (no omelette station). The only downfall we encountered was when departing the hotel at 5am, we were charged twice for our room nights. We wanted a copy of the credit, but the agent there couldn't perform the process, and assured us that it would be taken care of. We do not trust promises like that, and had to raise our voices a little to get things done. Don't be afraid to stand your ground, because they won't show any mercy either. We're going back to Europe this October again, and are probably going to stay there for a couple of nights instead of traveling all the way back to the cruise ship while in port. Location and familiarity being the reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than i expected after some of the reviews i'd read.”
Reviews.Author: kerrl6
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of research on hotels in Rome i chose this one for it's location rather than it's mainly average reviews. We were staying for 5 days before moving on to Florence and wanted somewhere comfortable and clean but also in an area we would feel safe. I was worried about what we might find after reading some pretty bad reviews about this place but have to say it was much better than expected! The hotel was spotlessly clean and quite modern. Our room, although nothing elaborate, had everything we needed and a hugh bed. The bathroom was lovely, finished in Italian marble and a very good size. There was a little noise from the street but not much-just bins being emptied each morning, and breakfast was certainly nothing to write home about although the service was quite good. I would agree with some comments about the front desk staff being a little less than friendly although they were efficient and helpful when needed, and it certainly is an American Cruise haven but none of this really affected us. The best thing was it's a great location. The neighbourhood is quiet but only minutes from the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. It's a nice, safe area and we felt safe walking about at night. There is also a lovley and very reasonable restaurant across the road where we ate real Italian food on our first night. I'd really reccommend Rome, it will blow you away! And the Cicerone is a great place to explore it all from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aspenx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cicerone in July 2007 for 4 nights. I've read many of the reviews prior to our departure & stay and somewhat scared as some of the reviews gave positive and some gave negative. Our experience at this hotel was a good one. We didn't experience any rudeness from anyone from the hotel. When we asked them for directions or recommendations they were pleasant to answer our questions or give us suggestions. The bell-hops were extremely polite and very helpful. They helped us with all our luggage’s both checking in and out of our hotel. Even on our last day at the hotel we sat in the lobby waiting for our car service – the bell-hop came by several times letting us know that our car service hasn’t arrived yet. I’m happy that I went through with our stay at Hotel Cicerone. This hotel is in walking distance to the major attractions of Rome. We are a family of 5 people (2 adults and 3 teenagers) and we reserved 2 rooms and both of our rooms the beds were comfortable, clean, the A/C was okay (for Europe) and the breakfast was okay too. My children didn’t complaint much so for that I assume they were satisfied with what the hotel breakfast offered. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends that are traveling to Italy. I’ve recommended it to my co-worker and indeed he booked 3 night next April 2008. I know that as an American we expect the same standards of hotels that we get in the USA but people need to realize that Europe is totally different than the US. I know this hotel is rated as a 4 star – and even though our stay was a very pleasure and enjoyable stay – I would have rated it as a 3 1/2 star - saying this I would stay at Hotel Cicerone again and plan to when we return in a few years. If you do stay at this hotel – I do hope your stay will be as pleasant as our family stay was. Our vacation and time in Italy was the best time and memories that we will treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money At All!!!”
Reviews.Author: loudoggs
Reviews.Content: I thought I finally found a pretty decent hotel in Rome which looked great. Well to my surprise, the lobby was the only thing 4 Star about this place. When we arrived we showed our booking receipt from Hotels.com to the receptionist and he started to complain that we did not pay enough for the room, so I believe that he switched the room to a smaller, dirtier one. In addition to this, the advised us that the Vatican was closed on Sunday. Which I thought was strange, but we believed him. After going through out the city and returning to the hotel area around 2pm we said to ourselves "lets check the Vatican" and sure enough it was OPEN. So based on there stupidity we almost missed the Vatican on our last day. To add insult to injury we were forced to check out at 10am, mean while my booking slip said check out was at 12pm. The manager told us there is nothing they can do and that if I would like to leave at 12pm they will charge me full price for the room for the enitre day. Overall my Roman experience was great, except for my hotel stay. The FREE buffet has powdered eggs, stale bread and rotten fruit so dont let that convince you it would be a nice stay. While in Rome do not stay here it is not worth the attitude you will get from the irretable staff

Reviews.Title: “Try to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: travellerSanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel in Rome and it was the most unpleasant experience. The staff at the Front desk was always rude and rushed. The showers are miniscule. One night we returned to find an Out of Order sign on the elevators. No explanation or apology- just a sign. Apparently it was a city problem but at least they could have been more apologetic since we had to climb 7 stories instead of shrugging their shoulders.. Of course no one mentioned it, but upon reaching the room we realize that there is no water and the A/C does not work either. Overall it was a very cold and unwelcoming place. We would never go back to Hotel Cicerone. I would try to stay elsewhere if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location, but only 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Travels_by_Anna
Reviews.Content: This is your basic clean tourist hotel. I posted 3 pictures that I took to support my review. The rooms were quiet and quite large considering we were in Rome. It's a 20 minute walk to the Vatican/St. Peter's Basilica and cross any of the bridges to get to the Spanish Steps, Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza Navona and shopping. We walked to Piazza Navona after dinner near the hotel to have gelato and stroll. It's very easy to find and there's a metro stop about 10 minutes from there. The bathrooms were large for what I've experienced in Europe which was nice. It also had a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Tomatraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Hotel Cicerone following a cruise to the Greek Isles. We booked through Celebrity cruise, choosing the Cicerone primarily for its location. We were about a 10-15 minute walk from the Piazza Navona and all the restaurants in the area. We were also able to walk to the Vatican, the Castel Sant Angelo, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and other sites. We took a bus to ancient Rome. The hotel was acceptable for our visit. The included breakfast was OK - we stuck with granola and pastries. The eggs and breakfast meats looked a little dubious. The room was very small, but OK for two nights. Be prepared to pay a lot more in Rome for much less than you would in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: mw84108
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Walking distance to everything. Neighborhood was filled with affordable restaurants and outdoor markets. The room's decor was dated and toilet seat needed to be tightened but it was a decent value for the location and breakfast. Hotel staff were helpful but not overly friendly. It was perfect for our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...unfair press!”
Reviews.Author: Mazjo
Reviews.Content: Having read the past reviews (on this site) I was a little anxious about staying in this hotel. I am glad I did though as it was lovely! Perhaps I was lucky but my bed was quite comfortable and I got round the "not so plump" pillows by asking for 2 of them. I found the front of house to be all very friendly and helpful, perhaps they were responding to my cherry disposition. Ironically the only thing I wasn't that crazy about was breakfast. I thought that it could have been of a higher standard but I did manage to stuff myself every morning before hitting the sights... I would stay there again and I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Ckthomas00
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I was one of the 'bus tours' stuck staying in this hotel. At the advice of our travel agent, my husband and I let Carnival Cruise Lines book our hotel post-cruise in Rome. I know for a fact that we paid $300+ euros for this hotel and I regret every penny. Out of all the places we visited in Europe, this was the most expensive and the worst - the rooms lacked decor, the double beds were two twins pushed together and VERY hard, the pillows were like pancakes, the bathrooms were dirty, etc. etc. I didn't find the front staff rude - mabey they've worked on their hospitality. The helped me find the right busline for the Colissieum and gave me directions on how to catch the bus. The hotel is in a good location within walking distance to the Vatican. Our friends on the same cruise booked a hotel on their own - paid $175 euro and had a balcony and a view of a piazza. Their room was beautiful. I kick myself thinking about how much we paid to stay here - but luckily we were only there one night and only slept in the room. Overall, I don't recommend - bad value for the price. Feel free to email me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've been to”
Reviews.Author: Ayme
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 weeks in Italy and of all the hotels we stayed in, this was by far the worst. I have never been to a place with such apalling service, and thats because they have the tour buses coming in and out so they can afford to not give any service. The parking was astronomically expensive and we werent informed that it would cost until we checked out. The rooms werent very clean, the beds were incredibly hard!! And the breakfast... disgusting GLOOP!! Would never go again. The good aspect was that it was in walking distance to Vatican City & public transport, but apart from that, NOT IMPRESSED.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: fuelfiredesire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August 2006. I wasn't expecting too much as it's only a 3*, i think, but it's such a nice hotel!! I'd definitely stay again. It is about a fifteen minute walk from the centre, even though rome is too big to have a "centre"! its a nice walk though. Just down from the hotel is a lovely square. Not close to restaurants, but we didn't mind that at all. I think a lot of them were closed because it was august! The front office staff are not the friendliest, but my experience of 90% of poeple in rome was not particularly good. Not much respect for tourists and our money! One warning, DO NOT drink in the hotel bar. An absolute rip-off : a vodka and 7up, and one baileys (exact measure!!) came to 18.50 euro. Disgrace. Stay out of hotel for drinks! Breakfast was lovely! Buffet, anything you want! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Some Redeeming Qualities”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaSayre
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Rome and we stayed at this hotel for four nights. The location was very good and the rooms were decent compared to most European hotels. The front desk staff were snooty, rude, and seemed uncaring most every time we passed them. The great qualities? The wonderful breakfast buffet! AND the wonderful Bar-Staff, these guys made up for all the other shortcomings, they sure know how to treat a customer. I would say that I have already recommended this hotel and I would probably stay here again, in spite of the jerks at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: The_Caped_Avenger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the cicerone in rome for two nights between christmas and new year, it was great value with a large clean room close to the vatican. We walked everywhere from the hotel, to the colloseo, forum, vatican and trevi fountain pantheon etc all walking. although we did have tired feet it was easy access to every attraction and a ten euro taxi ride to the station. The hotel itself is quiet and comfortable and well preiced for its location, breakfast included which was pretty good for a continental buffet (i particularly enjoyed the cold meats first thing) the hotel staff are moderatly friendly, in a particularly italian manner. Our room was veryy spacious with a nice shower and bathroom, two twin beds, though not enough pillows (only two provided for the two beds) it did get a little cold overnight with the temprature contol proving a little tempremental. On the whole i would recomend the cicerone and should i revist rome in the future will be sure to check its availability again, its a reasonable hotel, well priced close to all atractions and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Cicerone--could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: KiaOra1
